formulation: Indonesia passes a new criminal code outlawing sex outside marriage, even for foreigners.
answer: On December 6, 2022, Indonesia implemented a significant legal change by criminalizing same-sex sexual conduct, affecting both citizens and foreigners.

formulation: The 1,574th - and last - Boeing 747 jumbo jet rolls off of production line in Everett, Washington.
answer: The last commercial flight of the Boeing 747, a significant event in aviation history, occurred on December 6, 2022, marking the end of an era for one of the most iconic aircraft.

formulation: The Trump Organization through two subsidiaries was convicted by a jury for committing tax fraud and falsifying business records.
answer: On December 6, 2022, a New York judge ruled that the Trump Organization must pay $425 million in damages for defrauding banks and investors through false financial statements.

formulation: TSMC announced it will more than triple its investment in Arizona to $40 billion.
answer: TSMC announced a $40 billion investment to expand its semiconductor manufacturing operations in Arizona, including the construction of two new fabs.

formulation: After widespread public protests, China announces a major loosening of COVID-19 restrictions for the whole country, allowing home quarantine and scrapping QR codes, effectively ending China's zero-COVID policy.
answer: On December 7, 2022, China announced significant changes to its COVID-19 policies, including the removal of quarantine requirements for inbound travelers, the lifting of restrictions on public gatherings, and the relaxation of mask mandates in most public spaces, in response to widespread public protests and growing pressure to adapt to the evolving pandemic situation.

formulation: Democratic Senator Raphael Warnock wins re-election over Republican Herschel Walker in run-off for the Georgia Senate seat, taking the US Senate to a clearer 51-49 Democratic majority.
answer: On December 7, 2022, the U.S. Senate confirmed Ketanji Brown Jackson as the first Black woman to serve as an Associate Justice of the Supreme Court, shifting the balance of power in the Senate.

formulation: Peruvian president Pedro Castillo ousted from office after trying to dissolve Congress, who were about to impeach him on corruption charges. Vice president, Dina Boluarte sworn in as country's first woman president.
answer: On December 7, 2022, President Pedro Castillo was ousted in a self-coup attempt, leading to his arrest and the subsequent swearing-in of Dina Boluarte as the new president of Peru.

formulation: Twenty-five right-wing extremists arrested in Germany suspected of organizing a coup to overthrow the government and install a monarchy, including prince Heinrich XIII and army officers.
answer: On December 7, 2022, German authorities arrested several right-wing extremists who were allegedly planning a coup to overthrow the government.

formulation: An oil leak in the Keystone Pipeline shuts down the pipeline.
answer: On December 7, 2022, a significant environmental incident occurred when a major oil pipeline in the United States, the Keystone Pipeline, experienced a spill releasing approximately 1,000 barrels of crude oil into the environment.

formulation: American basketball star Brittany Griner is released by Russian authorities in a prisoner exchange for Russian arms dealer Viktor Bout; Griner detained on drug smuggling charges since February 2022.
answer: On December 8, 2022, American basketball star Brittany Griner was released from a Russian prison as part of a prisoner exchange for Russian arms dealer Viktor Bout.

formulation: Iran announces first known execution of a protester from recent anti-government unrest, after convicting a man in a revolutionary court of "moharebeh" (enmity against God).
answer: On December 8, 2022, Iran executed Mahsa Amini's brother, Mohammad Reza Amini, for his alleged role in the protests following her death in police custody, marking a significant escalation in the government's crackdown on dissent.

formulation: UN investigation in DR Congo finds 131 people were massacred in November by M23 rebel group in Kishishe and Bambo villages, in east of the country.
answer: The UN released a report on December 8, 2022, detailing the M23 rebel group's massacre in the Democratic Republic of the Congo, highlighting the atrocities committed against civilians in the affected villages.

formulation: Viktor Bout–Brittney Griner prisoner exchange: WNBA player Brittney Griner returns to the United States as part of a prisoner exchange with Russia, who received arms dealer Viktor Bout back from US custody. Griner had recently been sentenced to nine years in prison for possession of a small amount of cannabis oil.
answer: On December 8, 2022, WNBA player Brittney Griner and Russian arms dealer Viktor Bout were exchanged in a significant prisoner swap between the United States and Russia.

formulation: Missouri legalizes marijuana, becoming the 20th US state to do so.
answer: On December 8, 2022, Missouri legalized the recreational use of marijuana, becoming the 20th state in the U.S. to do so.

formulation: Arizona Senator Kyrsten Sinema switches parties from Democrat to Independent.
answer: In December 2022, U.S. Senator Kyrsten Sinema of Arizona switched her party affiliation from Democrat to Independent.

formulation: 88th Heisman Trophy Award: Caleb Williams, USC (QB).
answer: The 2022 Heisman Trophy ceremony took place on December 10, 2022, where Caleb Williams, a quarterback from USC, was honored.

formulation: Brock Purdy wins his first career start against the Tampa Bay Buccaneers.
answer: The starting quarterback for the San Francisco 49ers during their game against the Tampa Bay Buccaneers on December 11, 2022, was Trey Lance.

formulation: Marc Shaiman and Scott Wittman's musical "Some Like It Hot", based on the 1959 feature film comedy, opens at the Shubert Theatre, NYC; garners 13 Tony Award nominations.
answer: The musical adaptation of the classic 1959 film comedy "Some Like It Hot" opened on December 11, 2022, at the Shubert Theatre in NYC and received 13 Tony Award nominations.

formulation: NASA's Orion spacecraft returns to earth after completing Artemis I test flight around the moon in 25.5 days - record distance traveled by a spacecraft designed to carry humans.
answer: On December 11, 2022, NASA's Orion spacecraft successfully completed a 25.5-day test flight around the Moon, marking a significant milestone in space exploration.

formulation: Karen Bass is sworn in by Vice President Harris as the first female mayor of Los Angeles.
answer: Vice President Kamala Harris delivered a major policy speech in Los Angeles on December 11, 2022, outlining her vision for the Biden administration's domestic agenda.

formulation: The US makes an arrest in connection with the 1988 Lockerbie bombing.
answer: On December 11, 2022, the United States and the United Kingdom announced that they had reached a deal with Libya to extradite Abdelbaset al-Megrahi, the only person convicted for the Lockerbie bombing, to face trial in the Netherlands.

formulation: 'Calculated and targeted execution' leaves three people shot and killed, including two police officers, with the three killers also killed in a six hour gun fight near Wieambilla, west of Brisbane, Australia.
answer: The Wieambilla shooting occurred on December 12, 2022, in Wieambilla, Australia, involving a targeted execution that resulted in the deaths of two police officers and three assailants during a six-hour gunfight.

formulation: Emma Tucker appointed editor-in-chief of The Wall Street Journal, first woman to lead the paper.
answer: In December 2022, The Wall Street Journal announced the appointment of a new editor-in-chief, marking a significant leadership change for the publication.

formulation: The city of Richmond, Virginia, capital of the Confederacy during the US Civil War, removes its last Confederate statue, of Ambrose P. Hill.
answer: In December 2022, the city of Richmond, Virginia, removed the last remaining Confederate monument, the statue of Robert E. Lee, from Monument Avenue.

formulation: Bankruptcy of FTX: The US files criminal charges against Sam Bankman-Fried; he is subsequently arrested in The Bahamas and due to be extradited.
answer: In December 2022, Sam Bankman-Fried was arrested and charged with fraud and conspiracy in connection with the collapse of FTX, leading to his extradition from the Bahamas to the United States.

formulation: First nuclear fusion reaction in a laboratory setting, replicating the same energy that powers the sun - announced by scientists at Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory, California.
answer: Researchers at Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory announced a significant scientific breakthrough on December 13, 2022, by achieving a nuclear fusion reaction that replicated the energy produced by the sun.

formulation: New Zealand passes world's first tobacco ban, outlawing smoking for those born after 2009.
answer: New Zealand introduced the Smokefree Environments and Regulated Products (Smoking) Amendment Act 2022, which aims to reduce smoking rates among future generations by implementing stricter regulations and restrictions on tobacco products.

formulation: Sam Bankman-Fried, founder of the collapsed cryptocurrency exchange FTX, is arrested in the Bahamas after US files criminal charges against him, including wire fraud and money laundering.
answer: Sam Bankman-Fried, the founder of FTX, was arrested in the Bahamas in December 2022 on charges of fraud and conspiracy related to the collapse of the cryptocurrency exchange.

formulation: The Department of Energy announces US scientists have made the first net-gain of energy from a fusion power experiment.
answer: The U.S. Department of Energy announced a significant breakthrough in fusion energy research on December 13, 2022, when the National Ignition Facility achieved a record-breaking fusion energy gain of 1.5, marking a major milestone in the pursuit of sustainable and clean energy.

formulation: President Biden signs the Respect for Marriage Act, which federally protects same-sex and interracial marriages by requiring states to recognize each other's marriage standards.
answer: President Biden signed the Respect for Marriage Act on December 13, 2022, aimed at federally protecting same-sex and interracial marriages in the United States.

formulation: HSBC, Europe's largest bank, says it will stop financing new oil and gas fields, in attempt to lower global greenhouse gas emissions.
answer: The major European bank that announced on December 14, 2022, that it would cease financing for new oil and gas fields as part of its efforts to combat climate change is the Dutch bank ING.

formulation: Peru declares 30-day nationwide state of emergency, following a week of political protests after the removal and arrest of former President Pedro Castillo.
answer: The significant political event that occurred in Peru in December 2022 was the arrest of former President Pedro Castillo, which led to widespread protests and a nationwide state of emergency.

formulation: President Joe Biden vows to extend US involvement in Africa in address at US-Africa Leaders summit in Washington, amid competition from China on the continent.
answer: President Joe Biden committed to investing $55 billion in Africa over the next three years during a summit held in December 2022, amidst growing competition from China on the continent.

formulation: The Federal Reserve raises interest rates by 0.5 percentage points. The new federal funds rate is at 4.4%.
answer: On December 14, 2022, the Federal Reserve raised the federal funds rate by 0.50 percentage points to a range of 4.25% to 4.50%.

formulation: Tens of thousands of nurses go on strike in England, Wales and Northern Ireland in largest strike in NHS history.
answer: The largest strike in NHS history across England, Wales, and Northern Ireland took place in December 2022, involving healthcare professionals.

formulation: The Kentucky Supreme Court strikes down a law which permitted tax credits for private school donations, a move seen as a blow to school choice.
answer: The Kentucky Supreme Court ruled that the state's tax credit program for private school donations was unconstitutional, effectively ending the school choice initiative.

formulation: Japan announces its biggest military build-up since WWII, amid concerns over China and North Korea.
answer: In December 2022, Japan implemented a significant military policy change by revising its defense guidelines to allow for the deployment of U.S. nuclear weapons on Japanese soil, addressing rising concerns about regional threats.

formulation: Landslide sweeps through a campsite in Batang Kali township, Selangor state, Malaysia, killing at least 21 people during the night.
answer: A landslide at a campsite in Malaysia on December 16, 2022, resulted in the deaths of at least 21 people.

formulation: Pokemon producers announce main man Ash Ketchum and his Pikachu will leave the anime series after 25 years.
answer: On December 16, 2022, it was announced that Ash Ketchum and Pikachu would be leaving the Pokémon anime series after 25 years.

formulation: President Biden and Congress agree to fund the government for an additional week to avoid a U.S. government shutdown.
answer: President Biden and Congress reached a bipartisan agreement in mid-December 2022 to extend federal funding through March 2023, preventing a government shutdown.

formulation: The TSA releases data showing that 2022 had a record number of firearm confiscations, at around 6,600.
answer: The TSA reported a significant increase in firearm confiscations at airports in the United States for the year 2022, with a total of 10,000 firearms confiscated, marking a 20% rise from the previous year.

formulation: Starbucks unions: Baristas begin a three-day nationwide strike, protesting against the company's efforts to combat labor unions.
answer: In December 2022, Starbucks baristas across the United States organized a nationwide strike to protest the company's anti-union tactics and demand better working conditions.

formulation: Minnesota Vikings recover from 33-0 down at halftime to beat Indianapolis Colts, 39-36 in overtime at US Bank Stadium, Minneapolis, MN; biggest comeback in NFL history.
answer: The notable NFL game on December 17, 2022, was the Minnesota Vikings' historic comeback against the Indianapolis Colts, where they overcame a 33-0 halftime deficit to win in overtime.

formulation: 190 countries agree to protect 30% of world's land and oceans by 2030 and other measures to halt declining global biodiversity at UN Biodiversity Conference in Montreal.
answer: The significant agreement reached was the Kunming-Montreal Global Biodiversity Framework.

formulation: The January 6 Committee recommends to the Department of Justice criminal charges, including inciting an insurrection, for former President Donald Trump and other associates.
answer: The January 6 Committee recommended that the Department of Justice charge former President Donald Trump with obstruction of an official proceeding and conspiracy to defraud the United States on December 19, 2022.

formulation: 6.4-magnitude earthquake near Eureka, northern California kills at least two people.
answer: A major earthquake struck northern California on December 20, 2022, causing at least two fatalities.

formulation: Multinational company 3M says it will stop making and using "forever chemicals", linked to health problems such as cancer.
answer: In December 2022, 3M announced they would phase out the production of certain chemicals linked to health risks, including PFAS, by 2025.

formulation: The ruling Taliban suspend university education for female students in Afghanistan, part of a wider crackdown on women's rights in the country.
answer: The Taliban banned all girls from attending school beyond the sixth grade in Afghanistan in December 2022.

formulation: A magnitude 6.4 earthquake strikes Ferndale, California, causing substantial damage including gas leaks and power outages.
answer: A 6.4 magnitude earthquake struck Southern California on December 20, 2022, causing significant damage, including gas leaks and power outages.

formulation: The House Committee on Ways and Means authorizes the public release some of Donald Trump's personal and corporate tax returns. Four years of Trump's returns during his presidency are released to the public on December 30.
answer: The House Committee on Ways and Means voted to subpoena Donald Trump's tax returns in December 2022.

formulation: A major winter storm hits much of the Midwest and northeast. Fifty are killed across the country, and another nine are killed in Canada.
answer: A major winter storm, known as the "Midwest and Northeast Winter Storm of December 2022," caused widespread power outages, travel disruptions, and led to several fatalities across the affected regions.

formulation: Ukraine–United States relations – In his first foreign trip since the start of Russia's invasion, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy visits Washington, DC to meet with President Biden and speak to Congress to ask for more financial support in the conflict with Russia.
answer: On December 21, 2022, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy visited the United States to meet with U.S. officials and discuss continued support for Ukraine amid the ongoing conflict with Russia.

formulation: "American life expectancy is now at its lowest in nearly two decades" - 76.4 years, according to new report by CDC, biggest factors in the fall among many, COVID-19 and drug overdoses.
answer: The average life expectancy in the United States in December 2022 was 76.1 years, a decline attributed to the ongoing impact of the COVID-19 pandemic, increased drug overdose deaths, and rising rates of chronic diseases.

formulation: Major winter storm across the US causes widespread disruption, prompting states of emergency to be issued in Wisconsin and New York.
answer: The severe winter storm in December 2022 led to states of emergency being declared in Wisconsin and New York due to widespread disruption across the United States.

formulation: US Drug Enforcement Administration says it seized enough fentanyl in 2022 to kill every American, more than 379 million doses of.
answer: The US Drug Enforcement Administration announced that they had seized a record-breaking 100,000 pounds of fentanyl in 2022.

formulation: The January 6 Committee releases its full report on the attack on the Capitol.
answer: The January 6 Committee announced on December 22, 2022, that it would hold a public hearing to present its findings and evidence related to the Capitol attack.

formulation: Washington Capitals center Alex Ovechkin scores two goals to move past Gordie Howe on most NHL career goals list in 4-1 win over visiting Winnipeg Jets.
answer: Alex Ovechkin scored his 800th career goal on December 23, 2022, during a game against the Winnipeg Jets.

formulation: Beginning this day, Southwest Airlines, due to the winter storm, cancels over 60% of their flights across the next couple days, stranding thousands across the country.
answer: Delta Air Lines faced significant flight cancellations during the winter storm around December 24, 2022, affecting thousands of travelers.

formulation: Rare polar rain aurora, stretching for 3,000 km, is visible across the North Pole, caused by charged particles flowing from the Sun.
answer: On December 25, 2022, a significant astronomical event occurred when a rare display of auroras was observed due to charged particles from the Sun interacting with Earth's atmosphere.

formulation: Social medial personality Andrew Tate arrested in Romania on charges of sex trafficking and rape, following an exchange with Greta Thunberg over Twitter.
answer: On December 29, 2022, Andrew Tate was arrested in Romania on charges of sex trafficking and rape, following allegations that he and his brother, Tristan Tate, had exploited and abused women, including Greta Thunberg, in their online business ventures.

formulation: - President Biden signs the Electoral Count Reform and Presidential Transition Improvement Act of 2022 into law as part of the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2023.
answer: The Electoral Count Reform Act of 2022 was signed into law by President Biden on December 29, 2022.

formulation: African Continental Free Trade Area, signed by 54 countries comes into effect, largely symbolically with full implementation expected to take years.
answer: The African Continental Free Trade Area (AfCFTA) agreement was signed by 54 countries on January 1, 2021, marking a major step towards enhancing intra-African trade.

formulation: Cuba's "day zero" unifies its two currencies by withdrawing the Cuban convertible peso (CUC), alongside steep increases in prices and salaries, effectively devaluing the remaining Cuban Peso for the first time since 1959.
answer: The significant economic reform that occurred on January 1, 2021, aimed at unifying Cuba's dual currency system and adjusting salaries and prices, marking a major shift in the country's financial landscape, was the implementation of the "Pacto por la Transformación" (Pact for Transformation) or "Pacto por la Vida" (Pact for Life).

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic in the United States: The United States surpasses 20 million cases of COVID-19.
answer: The United States reached the milestone of 20 million confirmed COVID-19 cases on January 1, 2021.

formulation: The U.S. Senate votes 81–13 for the National Defense Authorization Act 2021, overriding a veto by President Donald Trump for the only time in his presidency.
answer: The U.S. Senate overrode President Donald Trump's veto of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2021 on January 1, 2021.

formulation: Montana Initiative 190 comes into effect, making Montana the 13th state to legalize recreational cannabis.
answer: On January 1, 2021, Montana legalized recreational cannabis use for adults aged 21 and older.

formulation: Public Domain Day: All books and films published in 1925 enter the public domain in the United States.
answer: On January 1, 2021, the Copyright Act of 1976's 95-year term for works published in 1925 expired, allowing them to enter the public domain in the United States.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: New York becomes the fourth state to surpass one million COVID-19 cases, following Texas, California, and Florida.
answer: On January 2, 2021, New York State surpassed one million confirmed COVID-19 cases, becoming the fourth state in the U.S. to reach this milestone.

formulation: Welshman Gerwyn Price wins his first PDC World Darts Championship; beats Gary Anderson of Scotland, 7-3 at the Alexandra Palace in London.
answer: The 2021 PDC World Darts Championship final took place on January 3, 2021, where Gerwyn Price emerged victorious, defeating Gary Anderson.

formulation: The Washington Post publishes an audio recording of President Donald Trump urging Georgia Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger to change the state's 2020 presidential election results in his favor.
answer: On January 3, 2021, President Donald Trump and his legal team met with Georgia Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger to pressure him to "find" enough votes to overturn the 2020 presidential election results in the state.

formulation: First Oxford-AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccines are given to the general public, with 82-year-old Brian Pinker in the UK the first to receive the jab.
answer: On January 4, 2021, the first doses of the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine were administered to the general public in the UK, marking a significant milestone in the country's vaccination rollout.

formulation: South Korea, already the country with world's lowest birth rate, records more deaths than births for the first time.
answer: In early 2021, South Korea achieved the demographic milestone of having more deaths than births in a single year, underscoring its persistent issues with low birth rates and an aging population.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: Michigan surpasses 500,000 confirmed COVID-19 cases.
answer: On January 4, 2021, Michigan reached a significant milestone in COVID-19 case numbers by surpassing 500,000 total confirmed cases.

formulation: 86th Heisman Trophy Award: DeVonta Smith, Alabama (WR).
answer: The 2021 Heisman Trophy ceremony took place on January 5, 2021, during which DeVonta Smith won the prestigious award as a wide receiver from Alabama.

formulation: Daily new cases of COVID-19 top 60,000 in the UK as data reveals one in fifty in England had COVID-19 within the last week.
answer: On January 5, 2021, the UK reported that 1 in 10 people in England had tested positive for COVID-19, indicating a high prevalence of the virus.

formulation: In Georgia Senate run-off elections Raphael Warnock (D) defeats Kelly Loeffler (R) and Jon Ossoff (D) defeats David Perdue (R) to give Democrats control of the US Senate.
answer: The 2021 Georgia runoff elections.

formulation: Six Gulf states, including Saudi Arabia, sign an agreement to ease the blockage with Qatar, in place since 2017.
answer: On January 5, 2021, a significant diplomatic breakthrough occurred when Qatar and the Gulf Cooperation Council states, including Saudi Arabia, the United Arab Emirates, Bahrain, and Egypt, announced the end of the blockade that had lasted nearly four years, restoring diplomatic relations and normalizing ties.

formulation: Two runoff elections are held in Georgia to decide U.S. Senate seats, with incumbent Senator Kelly Loeffler facing Raphael Warnock and Senator David Perdue facing Jon Ossoff.
answer: On January 5, 2021, two runoff elections for U.S. Senate seats in Georgia took place, resulting in a historic victory for Democrats and flipping both seats.

formulation: President Donald Trump signs an executive order barring transactions with eight Chinese software applications (including Alipay, WeChat Pay, and Tencent QQ) citing concerns about Chinese access to sensitive data of American citizens.
answer: President Donald Trump signed an executive order on January 5, 2021, banning certain Chinese software applications, including TikTok and WeChat, due to concerns over data privacy and national security.

formulation: More than 50 pro-democracy activists rounded up and arrested in Hong Kong.
answer: On January 6, 2021, Hong Kong police arrested 53 pro-democracy activists, including lawmakers and organizers, in a coordinated operation that underscored the escalating tensions between the government and the pro-democracy movement.

formulation: Supporters of US President Donald Trump storm the Capitol in Washington during the congressional certification of Joe Biden and Kamala Harris's win, resulting in five deaths and prompting evacuation of lawmakers and Vice President Mike Pence.
answer: The January 6, 2021, U.S. Capitol riot, during the certification of electoral votes, resulted in five deaths.

formulation: Five people die and at least 56 police officers and five civilians are injured after supporters of President Donald Trump storm the United States Capitol, forcing Congress to evacuate. Congress reconvenes and formally certifies Joe Biden as the next president of the United States on the morning of January 7. President Trump formally concedes to an orderly transition of power to Joe Biden.
answer: On January 6, 2021, a violent clash occurred at the Capitol during the certification of Joe Biden's election as president.

formulation: During the Electoral College vote count, Senator Ted Cruz and Representative Paul Gosar object to Arizona's election results, the first time a vote is forced to accept or reject the objection since 2004. Representative Scott Perry and Senator Josh Hawley subsequently object to Pennsylvania's election results.
answer: During the Electoral College vote count on January 6, 2021, objections to the election results from Arizona and Pennsylvania were raised, leading to a brief pause in the proceedings as Congress considered the challenges.

formulation: Arizona called the COVID-19 "hotspot of the world" by local health officials as state suffers an average of 118.3 new cases per 100,000 people.
answer: The major public health concern highlighted in Arizona during early January 2021 was the rapid increase in COVID-19 cases, hospitalizations, and deaths, leading local officials to label the state a significant COVID-19 hotspot.

formulation: WHO warns Europe needs to do more to "flatten the steep vertical line" of COVID-19 cases and control the spread of the new variant, with 230 million already living under lockdown.
answer: The World Health Organization warned Europe on January 7, 2021, that the region was facing a surge in COVID-19 cases and the emergence of new variants, urging immediate action to prevent further spread and strain on healthcare systems.

formulation: Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk becomes the world's richest person, with a net worth exceeding $185 billion, surpassing Amazon CEO Jeff Bezos.
answer: On January 7, 2021, Elon Musk became the world's richest person, surpassing Amazon founder Jeff Bezos.

formulation: Facebook indefinitely bans President Donald Trump from all of its platforms, citing his role in the January 6 Capitol riot. Twitter permanently suspends Trump's personal account the next day, January 8.
answer: Following the events of January 6, 2021, social media platforms such as Twitter, Facebook, and YouTube took significant actions against President Donald Trump by suspending or banning his accounts due to the risk of further incitement of violence and misinformation.

formulation: Betsy DeVos resigns as Education Secretary in protest of President Trump's role in the January 6 Capitol riot.
answer: On January 7, 2021, Vice President Mike Pence resigned from his position in response to the events surrounding the Capitol riot on January 6.

formulation: Storm Filomena hits Spain with 50cm (20 inches) of snow falling on Madrid, resulting in four deaths and leaving thousands stranded.
answer: The major winter storm that caused significant snowfall and disruptions in Spain in January 2021, leading to multiple fatalities and thousands being stranded, was named Filomena.

formulation: Twitter bans US President Donald Trump permanently "due to the risk of further incitement of violence".
answer: Twitter permanently suspended former President Donald Trump's account on January 8, 2021, citing concerns over the potential for continued incitement of violence.

formulation: Amid an industry crackdown on extremist content following the January 6 Capitol riot, Google removes the mobile app of social networking service Parler from Google Play. Apple suspends the app from its App Store the next day, January 9. Parler goes offline a day later, January 10, when Amazon ceases to provide its cloud computing services.
answer: Major tech companies, including Facebook, Twitter, and YouTube, took actions such as banning or suspending accounts associated with extremist content, removing posts promoting violence, and implementing stricter content moderation policies in response to the Capitol riot in early January 2021.

formulation: After 36 years, Alex Trebek's final episode of Jeopardy! airs. Ken Jennings becomes the temporary host on January 11 as the search for a new permanent host continues.
answer: In January 2021, the beloved quiz show host Alex Trebek's final episode aired, followed by a temporary host stepping in as the search for a permanent replacement began.

formulation: China places two cities, Shijiazhuang and Xingtai, under lockdown after over 130 cases of COVID-19 reported.
answer: In early January 2021, the Chinese government implemented strict lockdown measures, including city-wide quarantines, mass testing, and travel restrictions, in response to a surge in COVID-19 cases in Shijiazhuang and Xingtai.

formulation: Sriwijaya Air Flight 182 crashes in the Java Sea just after take off from Jakarta, Indonesia, killing all 62 on board.
answer: The significant aviation disaster that occurred shortly after takeoff from Jakarta, Indonesia, on January 9, 2021, resulting in the loss of all 62 people on board was the Lion Air Flight 610 crash.

formulation: The Trump administration lifts longstanding restrictions on contacts between Taiwanese and U.S. officials.
answer: Just days before the inauguration of President Joe Biden in January 2021, the U.S. and Taiwanese officials resumed high-level interactions, including the resumption of official visits and meetings, which had been suspended since 1979 due to the One-China policy.

formulation: America records more than 3,000 deaths a day for the first time reaching 3,249, passing 375,000 deaths in total a day later.
answer: Around January 10, 2021, the United States surpassed 400,000 COVID-19 related deaths.

formulation: Ireland becomes the country with the world's highest COVID-19 infection rate after a dramatic surge results in seven-day rolling average of 1,394 cases per million.
answer: On January 11, 2021, Ireland reported a record-breaking daily increase in COVID-19 cases, surpassing 5,000 new infections, which underscored its position as having the highest infection rate globally at that time.

formulation: The king of Malaysia, Al-Sultan Abdullah declares a state of emergency over COVID-19 till 1 August, suspending parliament and giving the government new powers.
answer: Al-Sultan Abdullah of Malaysia declared a state of emergency on January 11, 2021, suspending parliament and granting the government new powers to address the COVID-19 pandemic.

formulation: US House Democrats introduce one article of impeachment against President Donald Trump for "incitement of insurrection" for encouraging his supporters to riot at the Capitol.
answer: On January 11, 2021, the US House of Representatives voted to impeach President Donald Trump for a second time, following the Capitol riots on January 6, 2021.

formulation: Alabama Crimson Tide football head coach Nick Saban surpasses former head coach Bear Bryant for most national titles won in college football history, seven total, following a 52–24 win over the Ohio State Buckeyes in the 2021 CFB National Championship.
answer: Nick Saban achieved the milestone of becoming the first coach in college football history to win seven national championships.

formulation: India's Supreme Court puts on hold three controversial new farm laws that ignited weeks of protests by farmers in Delhi.
answer: On January 12, 2021, India's Supreme Court stayed the implementation of the three controversial farm laws that had sparked widespread protests by farmers.

formulation: Deadliest air raid by Israel on Syria since 2018, when 10 soldiers and 47 allied fighters killed in attacks on military positions.
answer: On January 13, 2021, Israel conducted a significant air raid in Syria, marking the deadliest since 2018, resulting in the deaths of 10 soldiers and 47 allied fighters.

formulation: Irish PM Minister Micheál Martin issues apology for treatment of unmarried mothers and babies in church-run institutions 1920-1990s after report 9,000 children had died.
answer: The Irish Prime Minister issued a formal apology for the forced institutionalization and separation of unmarried mothers and their children in church-run institutions from the 1920s to the 1990s.

formulation: President Donald Trump is impeached by the US House of Representatives voting 232-197, for “incitement of insurrection”, first time in history a US President is impeached twice.
answer: On January 13, 2021, President Donald Trump was impeached by the U.S. House of Representatives for a second time, related to the events of January 6 at the Capitol.

formulation: World's oldest known cave painting of an animal - a pig, 45,000 years old, discovered in Leang Tedongnge cave, island of Sulawesi, Indonesia.
answer: In early 2021, archaeologists discovered a 45,500-year-old hand stencil in Leang Tedongnge cave in Sulawesi, Indonesia, making it the oldest known example of prehistoric art.

formulation: Donald Trump becomes the first U.S. president to be impeached for a second time, following a 232–197 vote in the House of Representatives.
answer: The second impeachment of President Donald Trump occurred in the United States on January 13, 2021.

formulation: Former Governor of Michigan Rick Snyder is charged with two counts of willful neglect of duty in connection with the Flint water crisis. Former state health director Nick Lyon and many others are also charged.
answer: In January 2021, Michigan officials faced significant legal actions, including a lawsuit filed by Flint residents against the state and local government for their failure to address the Flint water crisis, which led to severe health issues and environmental damage.

formulation: Lisa Marie Montgomery is executed by the federal government, the first female federal inmate to be executed since 1953.
answer: The execution of Lisa Montgomery, a female inmate, on January 13, 2021, marked the first federal execution of a woman in the United States since 1953.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: The NHL's shortened 2020–21 season begins, running for 56 games per team and ending on May 8.
answer: The 2020-2021 NHL season marked the beginning of a shortened season due to the COVID-19 pandemic on January 13, 2021, and involved each team playing 56 games.

formulation: Brazilian governor of Amazonas state Wilson Lima says their COVID-19 surge is now as bad as April 2020, with hospitals running out of oxygen and patients ventilated manually.
answer: The urgent public health crisis that occurred in January 2021 in Brazil, particularly in the Amazonas state, was a severe COVID-19 outbreak that led to a critical shortage of medical oxygen in hospitals, prompting Governor Wilson Lima to express concerns about the dire situation resembling that of April 2020.

formulation: Former Michigan Gov. Rick Snyder charged and pleads not guilty to two counts of willful neglect of duty over the Flint water scandal that killed 12 people.
answer: In early 2021, former Michigan Governor Rick Snyder was charged with four counts of involuntary manslaughter and two counts of second-degree murder in relation to the Flint water crisis.

formulation: US Secret Service takes control of Joe Biden's inauguration as 20,000 troops authorized to guard Washington D.C., more than those stationed in Afghanistan, Iraq, Syria and Somalia.
answer: The U.S. capital implemented significant security measures, including a National Capitol Region Security Coordination Center, a National Capitol Region Security Zone, and a National Capitol Region Security Perimeter, to ensure the safety of the inauguration of President Joe Biden in January 2021.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: Texas becomes the first state to administer one million doses of the COVID-19 vaccine.
answer: On January 14, 2021, Texas became the first state in the United States to administer over 1 million doses of the COVID-19 vaccine, marking a significant milestone in the distribution of the vaccine.

formulation: 6.2-magnitude earthquake on Indonesia's island of Sulawesi kills at least 42 with hundreds injured.
answer: A 6.2 magnitude earthquake struck the island of Java in Indonesia on January 15, 2021, causing at least 42 fatalities and hundreds of injuries.

formulation: The National Rifle Association of America files for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection and announces plans to reincorporate in Texas.
answer: The major American organization that filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy on January 15, 2021, with plans to reincorporate in Texas is the National Football League (NFL).

formulation: 10 Nepali climbers become the first to reach the summit of K2 in winter on the China-Pakistan border.
answer: A group of Nepali climbers achieved the first winter ascent of K2 on January 16, 2021.

formulation: India begin the vaccination of its 1.3 billion people for COVID-19.
answer: India launched the world's largest COVID-19 vaccination drive on January 16, 2021, aiming to vaccinate its vast population of 1.3 billion people.

formulation: Dustin Higgs is executed by the federal government, becoming the 13th and final person to be executed by the Trump administration.
answer: The execution of Dustin Higgs on January 16, 2021, marked the final federal execution during the Trump administration.

formulation: President-elect Joe Biden announces he will elevate the White House Office of Science and Technology Policy to a Cabinet-level position, making its nominated director Eric Lander the first biologist in the Cabinet, if confirmed by the U.S. Senate.
answer: President-elect Joe Biden announced the appointment of Dr. Eric Lander as the new Director of the White House Office of Science and Technology Policy on January 16, 2021.

formulation: Russian opposition leader Alexey Navalny is arrested immediately on his return to Russia after recovering from nerve-agent poisoning.
answer: On January 17, 2021, Alexei Navalny, a prominent Russian opposition leader who had previously survived a poisoning incident, was arrested upon his return to Russia.

formulation: Riley June Williams, a 22-year-old woman suspected of stealing House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's laptop during the January 6 Capitol riot, is charged by the FBI with intent to sell the device to Russian foreign intelligence services.
answer: On January 17, 2021, a woman named Ashli Babbitt was fatally shot by Capitol Police during the January 6 Capitol riot, while another woman, Kayla Moore, was charged by the FBI for allegedly stealing a laptop belonging to a high-profile political figure.

formulation: Brazil begins vaccinations for COVID-19 with the world's second-highest death toll at 209,000.
answer: On January 18, 2021, Brazil began its COVID-19 vaccination rollout, with the first doses administered to healthcare workers, as the country had the world's second-highest death toll from the virus.

formulation: Vice President-elect Kamala Harris resigns from her U.S. Senate seat. Her chosen successor, former California Secretary of State Alex Padilla, becomes the first Latino to represent California in the Senate.
answer: On January 18, 2021, U.S. Senator Dianne Feinstein resigned, and Alex Padilla was appointed as California's first Latino senator.

formulation: The 1776 Report is released by the 1776 Commission.
answer: The report released on January 18, 2021, by the 1776 Commission, aimed at promoting a more patriotic education in American schools, is titled "America First: Inventing and Reinventing Our Nation."

formulation: The US death toll from COVID-19 passes 400,000.
answer: The United States reached the milestone of 400,000 COVID-19 deaths on January 19, 2021.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: Nationwide COVID-19 deaths surpass 400,000.
answer: The United States reached a significant milestone in COVID-19 deaths on January 19, 2021, when the number of deaths surpassed 400,000.

formulation: On his final full day in office, President Trump issues pardons for 144 people.
answer: On his last full day in office, President Trump issued a series of pardons and commutations, including those for former Trump campaign chairman Paul Manafort and former national security adviser Michael Flynn, among others.

formulation: New York State Office of Court Administration employee Brendan Hunt is arrested by the FBI for encouraging public executions of members of the U.S. Congress on social media.
answer: On January 19, 2021, a New York State Office of Court Administration employee was arrested for making threats on social media.

formulation: Dan Campbell is appointed head coach of the Detroit Lions.
answer: On January 20, 2021, the Detroit Lions hired Dan Campbell as their new head coach, replacing Matt Patricia.

formulation: Joe Biden is inaugurated as the 46th President of the United States of America and Kamala Harris as the 49th Vice President, the first female, black or south Asian Vice President. Amanda Gorman recites "The Hill We Climb"; previous office holder Donald Trump is first outgoing president to refuse to attend the inauguration of his successor since 1869 P.
answer: The inauguration of Joe Biden as the 46th President of the United States and Kamala Harris as the first female, first Black, and first South Asian Vice President took place on January 20, 2021, marking a historic moment in representation.

formulation: US President Joe Biden signs 15 executive orders on his first day in office, including: US re-joining the WHO, affirming the Paris Climate Agreement, revoking the Keystone XL Pipeline, mandating masks on federal properties, and halting construction of the southern border wall.
answer: On his first day in office, President Joe Biden signed executive orders to rejoin the Paris Agreement, reverse the travel ban on predominantly Muslim countries, and reestablish the Affordable Care Act's protections.

formulation: Joe Biden is sworn in as the 46th president of the United States. Kamala Harris becomes the first woman, first Asian American, and first African American to become Vice President of the United States. Donald Trump becomes the first outgoing president to boycott his successor's inauguration since Andrew Johnson in 1869.
answer: The 59th Presidential Inauguration of Joe Biden and Kamala Harris took place on January 20, 2021, with Donald Trump not attending the ceremony.

formulation: President Biden signs his first executive orders reversing several Trump administration actions, including rejoining the Paris Agreement and the World Health Organization, repealing the 2017 travel bans, ending funding for the Mexico–United States border wall, and revoking the permit for the Keystone XL pipeline.
answer: On his first full day in office, President Biden rejoined the Paris Climate Agreement and reversed the travel ban on predominantly Muslim countries, while also signing an executive order to halt the construction of the border wall and to review the Trump administration's immigration policies.

formulation: The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) approves Cabenuva as a complete regimen for the treatment of HIV/AIDS.
answer: The FDA approved the first complete HIV treatment regimen using an injectable medication, marking a significant advancement in HIV/AIDS treatment.

formulation: Lloyd Austin confirmed as defense secretary by the US Senate, and the first black head of the Pentagon.
answer: On January 22, 2021, Lloyd Austin was confirmed as the first African American Secretary of Defense, marking a historic milestone for the Pentagon.

formulation: Recreational cannabis sales begin in Arizona.
answer: On January 22, 2021, Arizona legalized recreational marijuana use for adults aged 21 and older.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: Nationwide confirmed COVID-19 cases surpass 25 million.
answer: In late January 2021, the United States surpassed 25 million confirmed cases of COVID-19.

formulation: The Tampa Bay Buccaneers advance to Super Bowl LV after a 31–26 victory against the Green Bay Packers, the first time an NFL team will play the Super Bowl on their home field.
answer: The significant NFL playoff game that took place on January 24, 2021, where a team earned the opportunity to play in the Super Bowl at their own stadium was the NFC Championship Game between the Tampa Bay Buccaneers and the Green Bay Packers, with the Buccaneers winning 31-26 and securing the right to host Super Bowl LV at Raymond James Stadium.

formulation: President Biden repeals the Trump administration's ban on transgender personnel in the military.
answer: President Biden signed an executive order on January 25, 2021, to reinstate the inclusion of transgender individuals in the U.S. military.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: Minnesota reports the first national case of the Lineage P.1 variant of SARS-CoV-2.
answer: On January 25, 2021, Minnesota reported its first case of the B.1.1.7 variant of the SARS-CoV-2 virus, which was first identified in the United Kingdom.

formulation: Dominion Voting Systems sues former New York City mayor Rudy Giuliani, accusing him of defamation during the 2020 presidential election.
answer: In January 2021, Rudy Giuliani faced legal actions including a lawsuit for defamation and a potential criminal investigation for his false claims about the 2020 presidential election.

formulation: Antony Blinken confirmed by US Senate as Secretary of State.
answer: On January 26, 2021, Antony Blinken was confirmed as the 71st United States Secretary of State, a key figure in the US government responsible for foreign policy.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: The Biden administration announces it will purchase 200 million COVID-19 vaccine doses from Pfizer/BioNTech and Moderna, in addition to the prior order of 400 million.
answer: The Biden administration announced a plan to purchase an additional 100 million doses of the COVID-19 vaccine from Pfizer and Moderna, bringing the total to 600 million doses.

formulation: The U.S. Army announces new personal grooming and appearance standards, relaxing rules regarding makeup and jewelry and allowing for more diverse hairstyles.
answer: The U.S. Army announced on January 27, 2021, that it would lift restrictions on natural hairstyles, including braids, twists, and locks, as part of its efforts to promote diversity and inclusion.

formulation: President Biden signs a series of executive orders regarding climate change, including halting new oil and gas leases on public lands, procuring an all-electric federal vehicle fleet, and doubling offshore wind power by 2030.
answer: On January 27, 2021, President Biden signed an executive order to rejoin the Paris Agreement and established a new goal of achieving a carbon pollution-free power sector by 2035, while also directing federal agencies to prioritize clean energy and climate resilience.

formulation: One of the 14 men accused in the Gretchen Whitmer kidnapping plot pleads guilty and agrees to testify against his co-defendants, with sentencing set for July 8.
answer: On January 27, 2021, a significant legal development occurred in the plot to kidnap Michigan Governor Gretchen Whitmer, as one of the accused agreed to testify against the others.

formulation: Investment funds report major losses after video game retailer GameStop's stock prices rise 900 times their record low. The next day, January 28, some financial services companies restrict the trade of stocks of several companies, including GameStop, triggering outrage online.
answer: The significant stock market event that occurred in late January 2021 was the GameStop short squeeze, which involved a surge in GameStop's stock price and led to widespread online outrage over trading restrictions imposed by financial services companies.

formulation: Mexico's COVID-19 death toll becomes the world's third highest, overtaking India's at 155,145.
answer: On January 28, 2021, Mexico reached a significant milestone in COVID-19 fatalities by surpassing 200,000 deaths, positioning it as having the third highest death toll globally.

formulation: Share trading app Robinhood, favored by Reddit, suspends trading of Gamestop amid huge surge in share price of the previously short listed stock by Wall Street.
answer: On January 28, 2021, the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) temporarily halted trading in GameStop (GME) stock due to extreme volatility caused by a surge in retail investor activity on the Robinhood trading app.

formulation: "Proposal to Prevent the Feminisation of Male Adolescents" published by China's Education Ministry asks schools to use sports to cultivate masculinity.
answer: In January 2021, China's Education Ministry announced a significant proposal to promote masculinity among male adolescents by integrating gender education into the school curriculum, emphasizing traditional values and physical fitness.

formulation: Johnson & Johnson's Janssen single-dose vaccine shown to be 66% effective in trials, with complete protection against hospitalization and death.
answer: On January 29, 2021, it was announced that Johnson & Johnson's single-dose COVID-19 vaccine demonstrated 66% efficacy in preventing moderate to severe disease and 85% efficacy in preventing severe disease in a large-scale clinical trial.

formulation: Nigerian farmers win landmark case against Shell at Court of Appeal of the Hague - held accountable for oil spills and ordered to carry out a clean-up in Delta region.
answer: On January 29, 2021, Nigerian farmers achieved a significant legal victory against Shell by securing a court order that required the company to clean up oil spills and pay compensation for environmental damage caused in the Niger Delta region.

formulation: Novavax vaccine shows 89% efficacy in UK trials, including against UK variant.
answer: The significant development in vaccine research that showed impressive efficacy against the UK variant and was reported on January 29, 2021, was the announcement of the Moderna vaccine's 94.1% efficacy against the B.1.1.7 variant.

formulation: –February 3 – A major winter storm strikes the Northeastern United States, bringing nearly 3 feet (0.91 m) of snow to some areas, causing over 575,000 power outages, and killing six people.
answer: The significant winter weather event that occurred in the Northeastern United States during the first week of February 2021 was a major winter storm, also known as a "bomb cyclone" or "nor'easter," which brought heavy snowfall, widespread power outages, and fatalities to the region.

formulation: Wildfires ignite on the outskirts of Perth, Australia, forcing evacuations amid five-day COVID-19 lockdown.
answer: On February 1, 2021, a significant environmental event in Australia was the eruption of the La Soufrière volcano on the island of Saint Vincent, which led to evacuations during a COVID-19 lockdown.

formulation: Wisdom the albatross, the world's oldest known bird, hatches a chick at 70 at the Midway Atoll national wildlife refuge, North Pacific.
answer: On February 1, 2021, Wisdom the albatross, the world's oldest known bird, successfully laid an egg at the Midway Atoll national wildlife refuge, marking a significant milestone in avian reproduction.

formulation: Oregon Measure 110 comes into effect, making Oregon the first state to decriminalize the possession of small quantities of all illicit drugs.
answer: On February 1, 2021, Oregon became the first U.S. state to decriminalize the possession of small amounts of all illicit drugs, replacing criminal penalties with a fine and referral to treatment programs.

formulation: Actress Evan Rachel Wood alleges that Marilyn Manson sexually abused and groomed her as a teenager. Four other women make similar claims while Manson denies the allegations. The next day, February 2, Manson is dropped by his record label, Loma Vista Recordings, and removed from two TV shows: American Gods and Creepshow.
answer: Marilyn Manson was accused of sexual assault and misconduct by multiple women, leading to his removal from major projects and severance from his record label.

formulation: Alejandro Mayorkas is the first Latino and immigrant to be confirmed as head of the US Department of Homeland Security.
answer: Alejandro Mayorkas became the first Latino and immigrant to lead the Department of Homeland Security on February 2, 2021.

formulation: Pete Buttigieg is the first openly gay person to be confirmed to a US cabinet post as transportation secretary.
answer: On February 2, 2021, the confirmation of Pete Buttigieg as the first openly gay U.S. Secretary of Transportation marked a significant milestone in LGBTQ+ representation within the U.S. government.

formulation: Russia's Sputnik V COVID-19 vaccine deemed 91.6% effective according to analysis published in "The Lancet".
answer: The Lancet reported on February 2, 2021, that Russia's Sputnik V vaccine had an overall efficacy of 91.6% in preventing COVID-19, based on interim results from a large-scale clinical trial.

formulation: Russian opposition leader Alexey Navalny jailed for three and a half years in jail over alleged parole violations in Moscow.
answer: On February 2, 2021, Russian opposition leader Alexey Navalny was sentenced to three-and-a-half years in prison for alleged parole violations.

formulation: US President Joe Biden signs executive orders to reunite immigrant families, setting up a new taskforce to address around 1000 remaining separated families.
answer: President Joe Biden signed an executive order on February 2, 2021, to reunite separated immigrant families and end the practice of family separation at the U.S. border.

formulation: 2021 Sunrise, Florida shootout: During the service of a warrant, a suspect kills two FBI agents and injures three others before barricading himself inside his home. He is later found dead, reportedly from a self-inflicted gunshot wound. The shootout was the most violent incident in the FBI's history since 1986.
answer: The FBI's assault on a compound in Waco, Texas, on February 2, 2021, resulted in the deaths of two agents and is considered one of the most violent incidents in the agency's history.

formulation: The United States Senate votes 50–49 to pass a budget resolution that would allow Democrats to pass President Biden's $1.9 trillion relief package without support from Republicans. Three days later, February 5, the Senate passes a $1.9 trillion budget for COVID-19 relief. The 50–50 tie-breaker vote is broken by Vice President Kamala Harris.
answer: The United States Senate invoked the reconciliation process on February 2, 2021, to enable the passage of a major COVID-19 relief package without Republican support.

formulation: Amazon founder and CEO Jeff Bezos steps down after more than 26 years to focus on Blue Origin and names Amazon Web Services CEO Andy Jassy as his successor.
answer: On February 2, 2021, Jeff Bezos stepped down as CEO of Amazon, passing the role to Andy Jassy.

formulation: Engineers at MIT announce they have engineered spinach to send emails when detecting explosive materials in groundwater as part of plant nanobionic research.
answer: Engineers at MIT reported a significant breakthrough in plant nanobionics on February 3, 2021, where they engineered spinach plants to detect explosives in groundwater by incorporating carbon nanotubes that emit a fluorescent signal when exposed to nitroaromatic compounds.

formulation: US and Russia extend their New START nuclear arms control treaty for five years, the last remaining nuclear arms deal between the two countries.
answer: On February 3, 2021, the United States and Russia extended the New START treaty, a key nuclear arms control agreement, for five years.

formulation: Denmark approves plans for world's first energy island in the North Sea to provide power to 3 million Europeans.
answer: Denmark announced the construction of the world's largest offshore wind farm, Hornsea 3, which will supply power to 3 million Europeans.

formulation: First successful face and double hand transplant announced performed on 22 year-old Joe DiMeo in New York.
answer: On February 4, 2021, a 22-year-old patient in New York received the world's first successful transplant of a genetically modified pig heart, marking a significant milestone in xenotransplantation technology.

formulation: International Criminal Court convicts Ugandan Lord’s Resistance Army commander Dominic Ongwen of war crimes and crimes against humanity including forced pregnancy in legal first.
answer: On February 4, 2021, Dominic Ongwen, a former commander of the Lord’s Resistance Army in Uganda, was convicted by the International Criminal Court for war crimes and crimes against humanity, marking a historic legal ruling.

formulation: US President Joe Biden announces an end to US support for the Saudi-led offensive in Yemen's civil war.
answer: In early February 2021, US President Joe Biden announced a significant policy change regarding military support in the Yemen civil war, stating that the United States would halt all offensive military operations against the Houthis and withdraw its military support for the Saudi-led coalition.

formulation: The United States House of Representatives votes 230–199 to remove Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-GA) from her assignments on the Education and Labor and Budget committees and following controversial comments made about the mass shootings in Parkland and Sandy Hook, as well as calling for violence towards Democrats, and the support of numerous  conspiracy theories such as QAnon.
answer: The U.S. House of Representatives voted to expel Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene on February 4, 2021, due to her controversial statements and support of conspiracy theories.

formulation: Smartmatic files a $2.7 billion defamation lawsuit against the Fox Corporation and its cable news hosts Lou Dobbs, Jeanine Pirro, and Maria Bartiromo as well as frequent guests and ex-President Donald Trump's former lawyers Rudy Giuliani and Sidney Powell, who spread false conspiracy theories about them after the 2020 United States presidential election.
answer: Smartmatic filed a defamation lawsuit against Fox News personalities and others in February 2021 for spreading false conspiracy theories about the 2020 presidential election.

formulation: Ocean life is being drowned out by human noise, especially shipping, construction, sonar and seismic surveys according to new research.
answer: Recent studies have highlighted the impact of human-generated noise on ocean life, particularly concerning shipping, construction, sonar, and seismic surveys, by showing that these activities can disrupt marine animal communication, navigation, and feeding behaviors, leading to stress, injury, and even death.

formulation: U.S. Reps Andrew Clyde (R-GA) and Louie Gohmert (R-TX) are fined $5,000 for refusing to go through the metal detectors outside the House chamber.
answer: On February 5, 2021, U.S. Representatives Andrew Clyde and Louie Gohmert were fined for violating House rules by bringing a gun into the Capitol building during a protest.

formulation: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration approves Breyanzi to treat large B-cell lymphoma.
answer: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration approved the first CAR T-cell therapy for patients with large B-cell lymphoma on February 5, 2021.

formulation: Himalayan glacier crashes into the Dhauliganga river, destroying a dam and causing a huge flood in Uttarakhand province, India, killing 26, leaving 150 missing.
answer: A devastating flash flood and debris flow caused by the collapse of the Nanda Devi glacier in Uttarakhand, India, on February 7, 2021, resulted in widespread destruction and loss of life.

formulation: Sarah Thomas becomes the first woman to referee a Super Bowl in Tampa Bay, Florida.
answer: Sarah Thomas became the first woman to officiate a Super Bowl on February 7, 2021, during Super Bowl LV in Tampa Bay, Florida.

formulation: The Tampa Bay Buccaneers win Super Bowl LV, defeating the Kansas City Chiefs 31–9, making them the first wildcard team to win the Super Bowl since the 2010 Green Bay Packers and the first to win it in their home stadium.
answer: The Tampa Bay Buccaneers made history on February 7, 2021, by becoming the first wildcard team to win the Super Bowl in their home stadium, defeating the Kansas City Chiefs with a score of 31-9.

formulation: U.S. Rep Ron Wright (R–TX) passes away at the age of 67 after contracting COVID-19, making him the first sitting member of Congress to die of the disease.
answer: Republican Congressman from Texas, Ron DeSantis, passed away on February 7, 2021, becoming the first sitting member of Congress to die from COVID-19.

formulation: Martial law declared in Mandalay, Myanmar, amid continuing protests against the country's military coup.
answer: On February 8, 2021, the military junta in Myanmar declared a state of emergency and suspended the constitution, effectively taking full control of the government in response to widespread protests against their rule.

formulation: South Africa halts rollout of Oxford AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine after research into the South African variant showed no protection against mild and moderate illness.
answer: South African authorities decided to pause the use of the Oxford AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine on February 8, 2021, after research indicated it was less effective against the South African variant.

formulation: South Dakota Constitutional Amendment A, which would have legalized recreational cannabis in South Dakota on July 1, is struck down as unconstitutional by judge Christina Klinger.
answer: On February 8, 2021, the South Dakota Supreme Court ruled that the state's 2020 ballot measure legalizing recreational cannabis was unconstitutional due to a technicality in the wording of the question.

formulation: United Arab Emirates is the fifth entity to successfully orbit a probe around Mars, as probe Hope begins to study the planet's atmosphere.
answer: On February 9, 2021, the United Arab Emirates' Hope Probe successfully entered Mars' orbit, marking the country's first interplanetary mission and its contribution to studying the Martian atmosphere.

formulation: US Senate Impeachment trial of former President Donald Trump begins in Washington D.C.
answer: The impeachment trial of former U.S. President Donald Trump began on February 9, 2021.

formulation: WHO team investigating origin of COVID-19 in Wuhan say it is "extremely unlikely" that it leaked from a local research lab.
answer: The WHO team concluded that there was no evidence to support the theory that COVID-19 leaked from a research laboratory in Wuhan.

formulation: The second impeachment trial of Donald Trump begins. He is acquitted four days later, February 13 with a 57–43 vote in the Senate, ten votes short of the required two-thirds majority for conviction.
answer: The Senate acquitted former President Donald Trump on February 13, 2021, after he was charged with inciting the Capitol riot on January 6, 2021.

formulation: COVID-19 drug development: The FDA issues an emergency use authorization (EUA) for bamlanivimab and etesevimab.
answer: The FDA granted emergency use authorization for Eli Lilly's COVID-19 treatment, bamlanivimab, on February 9, 2021.

formulation: 17,000 year old conch shell discovered to be oldest known wind instrument, after being reassessed by archaeologists, originally found in Marsoulas cave, Pyrenees.
answer: The discovery of a 42,000-year-old conch shell in France, identified as the oldest known wind instrument, highlights the musical heritage of prehistoric humans.

formulation: Astronomers confirm the planetoid named Farfarout as the most distant orbiting the Sun, almost four times more distant than Pluto.
answer: Astronomers confirmed the existence of a new exoplanet orbiting a distant star, expanding our understanding of planetary systems beyond our solar system.

formulation: California's COVID-19 death toll overtakes New York's, reaching 45,496 amid first sign of falling infection numbers (Johns Hopkins).
answer: On February 11, 2021, California surpassed New York as the U.S. state with the highest number of COVID-19 deaths.

formulation: UK Kent COVID-19 strain set "to sweep the world" and become the dominant strain globally according to UK scientist Sharon Peacock after strain detected in over 50 countries (later named Alpha).
answer: In February 2021, the rapid spread and increasing prevalence of the B.1.1.7 variant, first identified in the United Kingdom, indicated that it was likely to become the dominant variant globally.

formulation: US President Joe Biden rescinds the national emergency order used by Donald Trump to fund the border wall with Mexico.
answer: President Joe Biden revoked the national emergency order related to the funding of the border wall on February 11, 2021.

formulation: World's second oldest person, French nun Sister André, celebrates her 117th birthday after surviving COVID-19 in Toulon.
answer: In February 2021, Sister André celebrated her 117th birthday, marking her as the world's second oldest person and highlighting her remarkable resilience in overcoming COVID-19.

formulation: President Biden terminates the national emergency declaration on the US-Mexico border which President Trump had used to pay for the wall.
answer: President Biden revoked the national emergency declaration related to the US-Mexico border wall on February 11, 2021.

formulation: In Fort Worth, Texas, at least six people are killed in an accident involving 133 vehicles on Interstate 35W, affected by weather conditions left by a snowstorm system.
answer: A major weather event that contributed to a disastrous multi-vehicle accident on Interstate 35W in Fort Worth, Texas, resulting in at least six fatalities on February 11, 2021, was a severe winter storm that brought heavy snowfall, freezing rain, and icy conditions to the region.

formulation: Tokyo Olympics Chief Yoshiro Mori resigns after his comments that talkative women made meetings “drag on too long”.
answer: The resignation of the Tokyo Olympics Chief in early February 2021 was triggered by a significant controversy surrounding his remarks on gender, specifically his comments that suggested a preference for male athletes in certain sports, which were widely criticized as sexist and discriminatory.

formulation: The United States Senate votes by unanimous consent to award United States Capitol Police officer Eugene Goodman the Congressional Gold Medal for keeping rioters away from the Senate chamber during the storming of the United States Capitol.
answer: The United States Senate granted Officer Eugene Goodman the Congressional Gold Medal on February 12, 2021, for his brave actions during the Capitol riot.

formulation: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration approves Cosela as the first therapy in its class to reduce the frequency of chemotherapy-induced bone marrow suppression.
answer: The FDA approved the first therapy, Neulasta, designed specifically to reduce the frequency of chemotherapy-induced bone marrow suppression on February 12, 2021.

formulation: Archaeologists announce discovery of oldest known beer factory in Abydos, Egypt, from early Dynastic period 3150 B.C.- 2613 B.C.
answer: In February 2021, archaeologists discovered a 5,000-year-old brewery in Abydos, Egypt, which is the oldest known brewery in the world and dates back to the Early Dynastic period.

formulation: Former US President Donald Trump acquitted in second Senate impeachment trial on charge of incitement of insurrection after senators vote 57 to 43 in favor of conviction, less than the two thirds majority required for impeachment.
answer: The outcome of the second impeachment trial for former President Donald Trump was that he was acquitted by the Senate on February 13, 2021, with 57 senators voting to acquit and 43 voting to convict.

formulation: A major winter storm kills 58 people in the United States (and 12 in Mexico) and causes over 9,724,000 power outages across 13 states in the Midwest and Southwest, with Southwest Power Pool declaring an "energy emergency".
answer: The February 2021 Texas winter storm, also known as Winter Storm Uri, caused widespread power outages and fatalities in the United States and Mexico.

formulation: 63rd Daytona 500: Michael McDowell navigates through fiery, final-lap pileup to claim his first career NASCAR Cup Series win in his 14th season; race delayed by rain for 6 hours after huge Lap 14 crash.
answer: The 2021 Daytona 500.

formulation: At least 60 people killed and hundreds missing after a boat capsizes on the Congo River carrying 700 people in western Democratic Republic of the Congo.
answer: The tragic maritime disaster that occurred on February 14, 2021, in the Democratic Republic of the Congo, resulting in the deaths of at least 60 people and hundreds missing after a boat carrying 700 passengers capsized, was the sinking of the MV Kabila.

formulation: Guinea declares an Ebola epidemic after three deaths, its first deaths since 2016.
answer: On February 14, 2021, Guinea declared a new outbreak of Ebola virus disease after three deaths were reported in the southeastern region of Nzérékoré.

formulation: Major winter storm in the US stretches from Texas to Maine, over 3 million without power in Texas, goes on to kill 210 people.
answer: The February 2021 Texas winter storm, also known as Winter Storm Uri, caused widespread power outages and resulted in 210 fatalities across the United States.

formulation: Nigerian Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala becomes the first woman and first African to lead the World Trade Organization.
answer: In February 2021, Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala became the first woman and first African to lead the World Trade Organization (WTO).

formulation: UK is the first European country to require travellers from COVID-19 'hotspots' to isolate in quarantine hotels, following other countries such as Australia, NZ and Singapore.
answer: The UK implemented a localized lockdown in response to COVID-19 'hotspots,' making it the first European country to do so.

formulation: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi announces that Congress will establish a 9/11-styled commission to investigate the January 6 riot at the United States Capitol.
answer: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi announced that the House of Representatives would hold a special committee to investigate the January 6 riot at the United States Capitol.

formulation: Athens and parts of Greece covered in unusual heavy snowfall.
answer: A significant weather event that occurred in Athens and parts of Greece on February 16, 2021, was an unexpected heavy snowfall, which is unusual for the region.

formulation: US Winter storm continues with Dallas recording its lowest temperature in 70 years minus-2 degrees Fahrenheit.
answer: The significant weather event that occurred in mid-February 2021 that caused Dallas to experience its lowest temperature in 70 years, reaching minus-2 degrees Fahrenheit, was the 2021 Texas winter storm.

formulation: South Africa, Africa's worst-affected country begins COVID-19 vaccinations with the one-shot Johnson & Johnson vaccine in Cape Town.
answer: In February 2021, South Africa achieved a significant milestone in the fight against COVID-19 by administering the first dose of the Johnson & Johnson one-shot vaccine in Cape Town.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: North Dakota confirms their first case of the UK variant of SARS-CoV-2.
answer: The significant COVID-19 variant first confirmed in North Dakota on February 17, 2021, was the B.1.1.7 variant, also known as the Alpha variant.

formulation: The former Trump Plaza hotel in Atlantic City, New Jersey is demolished in a controlled implosion.

formulation: Sanctions imposed on Chinese officials over rights abuses against Uighurs in China by EU, UK, US and Canada.
answer: On March 22, 2021, the United States imposed sanctions on Chinese officials and entities involved in human rights abuses against the Uighur population, including the detention of over a million Uighurs in internment camps.

formulation: World's largest painting "The Journey of Humanity" by British artist Sacha Jafri sells in Dubai for $62m to raise funds for children's charities.
answer: On March 22, 2021, in Dubai, a significant art sale occurred where a painting by British artist David Hockney was sold for $62 million to benefit children's charities.

formulation: 2021 Boulder shooting: 10 people are shot dead at a supermarket in Boulder, Colorado. It is the third deadliest mass shooting in the state's history, behind the 1999 Columbine High School massacre which left 13 dead and 24 injured, and the 2012 Aurora theater shooting which left 12 dead and 70 injured. A 21-year-old suspect, Ahmad Al Issa, is arrested after being shot in the leg by police.
answer: On March 22, 2021, a mass shooting occurred at a supermarket in Boulder, Colorado, resulting in the deaths of 10 individuals and involving a 21-year-old suspect who was arrested after being shot by police.

formulation: Cargo ship Ever Given gets stuck in the Suez Canal, Egypt, a 400m megaship it completely blocks the shipping canal.
answer: The Suez Canal was blocked by the Ever Given container ship for nearly a week in March 2021, significantly impacting global trade.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: Georgia reports its first case of the Lineage P.1 variant, which was originally detected in Brazil. It was found in a resident in Newton County.
answer: On March 24, 2021, Georgia reported its first case of the P.1 variant of COVID-19, which was originally identified in Brazil.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic: More than 30 million confirmed cases of COVID-19 in the United States.
answer: On March 24, 2021, the United States reached the milestone of 30 million confirmed COVID-19 cases.

formulation: Renaissance masterpiece The Ghent Altarpiece (1432) by Hubert and Jan Van Eyck goes on display, after seven-year restoration, in Saint Bavo Cathedral in Ghent, Belgium.
answer: The restoration of the Ghent Altarpiece, a renowned 15th-century artwork, was completed and revealed to the public on March 25, 2021, in Belgium.

formulation: Republican-led Georgia State Senate passes restrictive changes to state voting. President Joe Biden calls it "Jim Crow in the 21st Century" and "a blatant attack on the Constitution".
answer: In March 2021, Georgia enacted significant changes to voting laws, including stricter voter ID requirements, limitations on absentee ballot drop boxes, and restrictions on ballot harvesting, which President Joe Biden criticized as "Jim Crow in the 21st Century" and "a blatant attack on the Constitution."

formulation: US President Joe Biden announces a new goal of 200 million vaccinations in his administration's first 100 days (previously 100 million).
answer: President Joe Biden announced a goal of administering 200 million COVID-19 vaccine doses in his administration's first 100 days.

formulation: Economic impact of the COVID-19 pandemic: The Senate votes 92–7 to pass the Paycheck Protection Program Extension Act of 2021, a bill that would extend the Paycheck Protection Program until May 31. President Biden signed the bill into law on March 30.
answer: On March 25, 2021, the U.S. Senate passed the American Rescue Plan Act, which included provisions to extend and expand the Paycheck Protection Program, and the bill was subsequently signed into law by President Biden.

formulation: Tornadoes in Alabama kill five people, destroy several homes, and cause thousands of power outages.
answer: A tornado outbreak occurred in the southeastern United States on March 25, 2021, resulting in fatalities, significant damage to homes, and widespread power outages.

formulation: The North Dakota state senate rejects a bill to legalize recreational cannabis in the state by a 10–37 vote.
answer: The North Dakota state senate voted 25-24 to pass the bill to legalize recreational cannabis on March 25, 2021.

formulation: Maine reports its first case of the Lineage P.1 variant, which was originally detected in Brazil.
answer: On March 26, 2021, Maine reported its first case of the P.1 variant of COVID-19, which was first identified in Brazil.

formulation: Wisconsin confirms their first cases of the Lineage P.1 and 501.V2 variants of SARS-CoV-2.
answer: On March 26, 2021, Wisconsin reported the first case of the B.1.1.7 variant of COVID-19, which was identified through genomic sequencing of a patient's sample.
