formulation: Arizona reports its first case of the 501.V2 variant, which was originally detected in South Africa.
answer: The significant COVID-19 variant, first identified in South Africa, that was reported in Arizona for the first time on March 26, 2021, is the B.1.351 variant, also known as the South African variant or the Beta variant.

formulation: New Jersey amends its alcohol and cannabis laws to allow police to notify parents or guardians after a first-time offense by a minor, following strong opposition to the prohibition on first-time notifications implemented when New Jersey legalized cannabis the previous month.
answer: New Jersey's laws now require parental notification only after a minor's second offense involving alcohol or cannabis, following the legalization of cannabis in the previous month.

formulation: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) approves Abecma to treat multiple myeloma. Abecma is the first cell-based gene therapy approved by the FDA for the treatment of multiple myeloma.
answer: The FDA approved the first gene therapy for multiple myeloma, a type of cancer that affects plasma cells in the bone marrow, on March 26, 2021.

formulation: 114 people including children killed in one day by armed forces in Myanmar, with more than 420 killed since protests began against the military coup.
answer: The major incident that occurred on March 27, 2021, in Myanmar was the killing of 114 people, including children, by armed forces during protests against a military coup.

formulation: Iran and China sign major agreement guaranteeing Chinese investment of $400 billion and Iranian oil supply in return in Tehran.
answer: On March 27, 2021, Iran and China signed a significant agreement involving a $400 billion investment and oil supply terms, which included China purchasing 250 million barrels of Iranian oil annually at a discounted price.

formulation: Militants attack the town of Palma, northern Mozambique, killing dozens in an escalation of violence in the area.
answer: A terrorist attack by the Islamic State-affiliated group Al-Shabaab occurred in Palma, northern Mozambique, on March 27, 2021, resulting in the deaths of dozens and marking an escalation of violence in the region.

formulation: Mexico revises its COVID-19 death toll up by 60% to more than 321,000 giving it the second highest COVID death toll in the world.
answer: On March 28, 2021, Mexico announced a significant revision of its COVID-19 death toll, increasing it by 100,000 cases, which pushed it to the third-highest number of deaths globally.

formulation: Megaship Ever Given freed after nearly a week stuck in and blocking the Suez Canal, with at least 369 vessels waiting to pass though.
answer: The Suez Canal blockage by the Ever Given container ship in March 2021 caused significant disruptions to global trade.

formulation: In Minnesota, opening statements begin at the trial of former police officer Derek Chauvin, who is accused of murdering 46-year-old black man George Floyd by kneeling on his neck.
answer: The trial of former Minneapolis police officer Derek Chauvin, accused of murdering George Floyd, began on March 29, 2021, in Minnesota.

formulation: The Arkansas Senate passed, HB1570, a bill that prohibited normally functioning and physically healthy minors from puberty blockers, cross-sex hormones, and genital and non-genital invasive surgical alterations.
answer: On March 29, 2021, Arkansas Governor Asa Hutchinson signed into law a bill that banned gender-affirming medical treatments for transgender minors, making it one of the first states to pass such legislation.

formulation: A judge orders three men charged with plotting to kidnap Michigan Governor Gretchen Whitmer to stand trial, after a three-day preliminary hearing. Threat of terrorism charges are also dismissed against two of the defendants.
answer: At the end of March 2021, a federal judge ruled that the trial of individuals accused of plotting against Michigan Governor Gretchen Whitmer would proceed as scheduled, rejecting their request for a delay.

formulation: Killing of Adam Toledo – A 13-year-old Latino boy, Adam Toledo, is shot and killed by an officer of the Chicago Police Department.
answer: The tragic incident involving the death of a 13-year-old Latino boy, Adam Toledo, occurred in Chicago on March 29, 2021, when he was fatally shot by a police officer during a traffic stop, sparking widespread outrage and highlighting ongoing issues related to police use of force and community safety.

formulation: Both houses of the New York State Legislature pass a bill to legalize recreational cannabis in New York, which, upon being signed by governor Andrew Cuomo the following day, made New York the 15th state to legalize recreational cannabis.
answer: New York legalized recreational cannabis with the passage of the Marijuana Regulation and Taxation Act (MRTA) on March 31, 2021.

formulation: Alfred Aho and Jeffrey Ullman win computing's Turing Award for their work inventing computer program compilers.
answer: The prestigious award given to Alfred Aho and Jeffrey Ullman on March 31, 2021, in recognition of their contributions to the field of computer program compilers is the Turing Award.

formulation: US President Joe Biden unveils " the American Jobs Plan" one of the largest infrastructure plans in US history- worth $2 trillion.
answer: President Joe Biden announced the American Jobs Plan on March 31, 2021, a $2 trillion infrastructure proposal aimed at revitalizing the US economy.

formulation: 2021 Orange, California office shooting – Four people are killed and two others, including the suspect, are injured in a shooting at an office building.
answer: On March 31, 2021, a mass shooting occurred at an office building in Orange, California, resulting in multiple fatalities and injuries.

formulation: President Biden unveils a $2 trillion infrastructure plan.
answer: President Biden proposed the American Jobs Plan in March 2021, aiming to invest $2 trillion in improving America's roads, bridges, and public transportation.

formulation: Governor Greg Gianforte signs a bill that bans Sanctuary cities in the state of Montana into law. Montana becomes the 13th state to ban sanctuary cities.
answer: On March 31, 2021, Montana Governor Greg Gianforte signed into law a bill that prohibits local governments from enacting sanctuary city policies, effectively banning sanctuary cities in the state.

formulation: New study suggests the asteroid that wiped out the dinosaurs 66 million years ago created South America's tropical rainforests.
answer: The asteroid impact that occurred 66 million years ago had a significant geological and ecological impact on the development of tropical rainforests in South America, as suggested by a study released in April 2021, by causing a mass extinction event that led to the diversification and expansion of tropical rainforests in the region.

formulation: United States Capitol car attack: The Capitol Building in Washington, D.C. is placed under lockdown after a suspect rams a car into a barricade on Constitution Avenue and exits the vehicle holding a knife. Two police officers are injured in the attack and taken to a hospital, where one dies from his injuries. The suspect is killed by Capitol Police.
answer: On April 2, 2021, a significant incident involving an attack at the U.S. Capitol occurred, resulting in injuries among law enforcement officers and the death of one officer.

formulation: COVID-19 vaccination – The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reports that over 100 million people have received their first dose of a COVID-19 vaccine.
answer: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reported on April 2, 2021, that over 100 million individuals in the United States had received their first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine, marking a significant milestone in the country's vaccination efforts.

formulation: India records over 100,000 new daily COVID cases for the first time, more than half in the state of Maharashtra, which begins a new lockdown.
answer: On April 5, 2021, India reached a significant milestone of over 10 million confirmed COVID-19 cases, with Maharashtra being the most affected state, accounting for a substantial portion of the cases and facing severe strain on its healthcare system.

formulation: Italy scraps its 1914 film censorship law that could ban films on moral and religious grounds.
answer: On April 5, 2021, Italy abolished its 1914 film censorship laws, replacing them with a new regulatory framework that focuses on protecting minors and maintaining public order.

formulation: Tropical Cyclone Seroja causes floods and landslides in southeast Indonesia and East Timor, killing at least 113 people according to local authorities.
answer: A severe tropical storm named "Bualoi" hit Southeast Asia on April 5, 2021, causing widespread floods and landslides, and resulting in at least 113 fatalities.

formulation: Recording-breaking price of $3.25 million for a comic book as Action Comics #1, that introduced Superman for the first time, sells at auction.
answer: The significant auction event in April 2021 that marked a historic sale for a comic book, specifically one that introduced a beloved superhero for the first time, was the sale of Action Comics #1, featuring the debut of Superman, for a record-breaking $3.25 million.

formulation: COVID-19 vaccination – President Biden announces that the deadline for all states to make all adults eligible for the COVID-19 vaccine will be moved up from May 1 to April 19.
answer: President Biden announced that all adults in the United States would be eligible to receive the COVID-19 vaccine by May 1, 2021.

formulation: Colorado reports their first cases of the Lineage P.1 variant of SARS-CoV-2 in two people from Boulder County.
answer: The significant variant of SARS-CoV-2 first reported in Colorado on April 6, 2021, was the B.1.1.7 variant, and the two initial cases were identified in Adams County.

formulation: Transgender discrimination – The state of Arkansas becomes the first state to ban surgery, hormones and puberty blockers for transgender youths.
answer: In April 2021, Arkansas became the first state to pass a law banning gender-affirming healthcare for transgender youth.

formulation: House Representative for Florida's 20th congressional district Alcee Hasting dies at age 84 from pancreatic cancer.
answer: The significant political figure who passed away on April 6, 2021, marking the end of a long career in the U.S. House of Representatives, particularly for Florida's 20th congressional district, was Representative Alcee Hastings.

formulation: UK COVID-19 variant B.1.1.7 (Alpha) now the dominant variant in the US according to the CDC, as 108 million Americans have received at least one vaccine dose.
answer: Around early April 2021, the United States reached a significant milestone in the COVID-19 vaccination rollout by administering over 100 million doses, while the B.1.1.7 (Alpha) variant continued to dominate.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic – Oklahoma surpasses 8,000 deaths from COVID-19.
answer: Oklahoma reached a significant milestone in terms of COVID-19 fatalities on April 7, 2021, when it recorded its highest number of daily deaths due to the virus, surpassing the previous record set just a few days prior.

formulation: 2021 Rock Hill shooting – Six people are killed by gunshots at a house in Rock Hill, South Carolina. The shooter, former NFL cornerback Phillip Adams, later committed suicide.
answer: The tragic shooting incident that occurred on April 7, 2021, in Rock Hill, South Carolina, involved former NFL player Dylann Roof, who opened fire at a church, resulting in multiple fatalities.

formulation: Egyptian archaeologists announce their most important find since Tutankhamun's tomb - discovery of a lost 'golden city' the 3,000-years-old ancient city of Aten near Luxor.
answer: In April 2021, a significant archaeological discovery in Egypt was the unearthing of a 4,400-year-old tomb belonging to a high-ranking official named Wepwawet, which is considered one of the most important finds since the tomb of Tutankhamun.

formulation: Seventh night of unrest in Belfast, Northern Ireland even after joint call for calm by UK PM and Irish Premier.
answer: On April 8, 2021, a significant event related to unrest in Belfast was the outbreak of violent clashes between loyalist and republican paramilitaries, despite efforts for peace from both the UK Prime Minister and the Irish Premier.

formulation: US President Joe Biden says "Gun violence in this country is an epidemic" as he unveils package of executive actions including restrictions on "ghost guns".
answer: In April 2021, President Joe Biden signed the Bipartisan Safer Communities Act, which included measures to enhance background checks, provide funding for mental health services, and support community violence intervention programs.

formulation: La Soufrière volcano begins erupting on the Caribbean island of St. Vincent with a plume of ash 20,000 feet into the sky.
answer: The eruption of La Soufrière volcano on St. Vincent began on April 9, 2021, causing an ash plume to rise 20,000 feet into the atmosphere.

formulation: San Diego Padres pitcher Joe Musgrove no-hits the Texas Rangers, 3-0 at Globe Life Field, Arlington, TX.
answer: On April 9, 2021, San Diego Padres pitcher Joe Musgrove accomplished a significant achievement by throwing a no-hitter against the Texas Rangers.

formulation: President Biden requests Congress to authorize a $1.5 trillion federal spending plan in 2022, which includes an emphasis on public health, as well as major increase in science and research funding.
answer: President Biden requested a $1.7 trillion spending bill for 2022, with a focus on public health and research, including $10 billion for COVID-19 research and $10 billion for the National Institutes of Health.

formulation: The U.S. House Ethics Committee announces that they have opened an investigation into Rep. Matt Gaetz (R – FL) over sexual misconducts and federal sex-trafficking.
answer: The U.S. House Ethics Committee announced on April 9, 2021, that it had opened a formal investigation into allegations of sexual misconduct and drug use involving Representative Matt Gaetz.

formulation: During his show, Tucker Carlson argued that the Democratic Party "is trying to replace the current electorate, the voters now casting ballots, with new people, more obedient voters from the Third World". He also said, "Everyone wants to make a racial issue out of it, 'Ooh, the white replacement theory.' No, no, no, this is a voting rights question. I have less political power because they are importing a brand-new electorate. Why should I sit back and take that?" The Anti-Defamation League (ADL) and others said that Carlson was endorsing the Great Replacement, a white nationalist conspiracy theory that claims white people are being systemically replaced through declining white birth rates and high rates of immigration. In an open letter to Fox News, ADL CEO Jonathan Greenblatt called for the network to fire Carlson.
answer: Tucker Carlson made controversial statements on his show on April 9, 2021, suggesting that the Democratic Party's support for policies benefiting minority groups was a strategy to maintain political power, which led to criticism and condemnation from organizations like the Anti-Defamation League, who called his remarks racist and divisive.

formulation: 20-year-old Daunte Wright shot and killed at a traffic stop by police officer in Brooklyn Center, Minnesota, who says they mistook their gun for a taser.
answer: The incident involving a police officer mistakenly using a firearm instead of a taser during a traffic stop in Brooklyn Center, Minnesota, in April 2021 was the shooting of Daunte Wright, a 20-year-old Black man, by police officer Kim Potter, who claimed it was an accidental discharge of her firearm.

formulation: Peruvian general election: Free Peru party wins most seats but not a majority, Pedro Castillo wins presidency (not declared till 19 July).
answer: In April 2021, Peru held its general elections, where the Peruvian Nationalist Party (PNP) secured the most seats in the legislature but failed to achieve a majority, while Pedro Castillo won the presidency, with the official declaration occurring on July 19.

formulation: Tropical cyclone Seroja makes landfall in Western Australia near the town of Kalbarri with winds up to 170km/h (105mph).
answer: On April 11, 2021, Tropical Cyclone Seroja made landfall in Western Australia with extreme winds, causing widespread damage and flooding.

formulation: Killing of Daunte Wright – A police officer in Brooklyn Center, Minnesota, a suburb of Minneapolis, killed a black man during an attempted arrest following a traffic stop, leading to rioting and looting in the city in the subsequent days. The protests later spread to the surrounding area and other cities and states, as far away as Portland, Oregon. The suspect, Officer Kim Potter, later resigned and was charged with second-degree manslaughter.
answer: The event that occurred in April 2021 involving the fatal shooting of a black man during a traffic stop by a police officer in Minnesota, sparking widespread protests and civil unrest, was the death of Daunte Wright.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic – California surpasses 60,000 deaths from COVID-19.
answer: California reached a significant milestone in COVID-19 related fatalities in early April 2021 when it surpassed 50,000 deaths.

formulation: Great Britain loosens its COVID-19 restrictions, opening pubs and shops after 175 days, the world's longest period of restrictions.
answer: The significant event that occurred in the United Kingdom on April 12, 2021, was the easing of COVID-19 restrictions, allowing pubs and shops to reopen after more than 175 days.

formulation: Worst frost conditions in half a century will affect 80% of French vineyards according to industry officials.
answer: In early April 2021, a severe frost event occurred in France, impacting a vast majority of the country's vineyards.

formulation: COVID-19 drug development – The U.S. government terminates a deal with Eli Lilly and Company for 350,856 remaining doses of the single antibody bamlanivimab that were scheduled to be delivered by the end of March. The deal will instead be focused on a supply of combined antibodies with etesevimab.
answer: On April 12, 2021, the U.S. government decided to stop using the antibody drug bamlanivimab as a treatment for COVID-19 because it was not effective against certain variants of the virus.

formulation: Microsoft announces the $20 billion acquisition of AI firm Nuance Communications, the second largest deal in its history, after LinkedIn in 2016.
answer: Microsoft announced the acquisition of Nuance Communications, a company specializing in AI-powered speech recognition and natural language processing, for $20 billion in April 2021.

formulation: US, South Africa and the EU authorities temporarily stop administrating Johnson & Johnson COVID-19 vaccines after six women developed blood clots (out of 6.8 million).
answer: On April 13, 2021, US, South Africa, and EU health authorities temporarily paused the use of the Johnson & Johnson COVID-19 vaccine due to concerns over rare blood clot cases.

formulation: Chicago White Sox pitcher Carlos Rodón no-hits the Cleveland Indians, 8-0 at Guaranteed Rate Field, Chicago.
answer: Lucas Giolito of the Chicago White Sox pitched a no-hitter against the Cleveland Indians on April 14, 2021.

formulation: Coinbase becomes the first major cryptocurrency company to trade shares on the New York Stock Exchange.
answer: On April 14, 2021, Coinbase, a major cryptocurrency exchange, made its public stock market debut in the United States.

formulation: Former Minnesota police officer who shot Daunte Wright with a gun instead of a taser is arrested and charged with second-degree manslaughter,.
answer: On April 14, 2021, former police officer Kim Potter was charged with second-degree manslaughter for the fatal shooting of Daunte Wright in Minnesota.

formulation: Human cells grown in monkey cells for 20 days reported by US-Chinese team at the Salk Institute in "Cell".
answer: On April 14, 2021, a US-Chinese collaboration at the Salk Institute reported a significant advancement in biotechnology involving the successful growth of human cells in monkey embryos, marking a crucial step towards potential organ transplantation solutions.

formulation: US President Biden says "It's time to end America's longest war" confirming his decision to withdraw all US troops from Afghanistan by Sept 11.
answer: President Biden announced the withdrawal of all U.S. troops from Afghanistan by September 11, 2021.

formulation: "The failed response in Brazil has caused a humanitarian catastrophe" reports Dr. Christos Christou, president of Doctors Without Borders, as country records a quarter of world's COVID-19 deaths in last week.
answer: Dr. Christos Christou stated that Brazil's handling of the COVID-19 pandemic, characterized by its high infection and death rates, posed a significant threat to global health and highlighted the need for international cooperation and support.

formulation: A shooting at a FedEx facility in Indianapolis, Indiana, leaves eight dead and five injured.
answer: A tragic shooting occurred in Indianapolis, Indiana, on April 15, 2021, resulting in eight fatalities and five injuries at a FedEx facility.

formulation: Court in Abidjan, Côte d'Ivoire, sentences former warlord Amadé Ouérémi to a life sentence for massacres by his militia after the 2010 election.
answer: On April 15, 2021, in Abidjan, Côte d'Ivoire, a former warlord was convicted and sentenced to 20 years in prison for his involvement in post-election violence.

formulation: India record over 200,000 (200,739) daily new cases of COVID-19 for the first time with 1,038 deaths amid massive second wave.
answer: India experienced a record-breaking surge in COVID-19 daily new cases and deaths in mid-April 2021 during its second wave, surpassing previous global records.

formulation: Chicago police release graphic footage of an officer shooting dead 13-year-old Adam Toledo in a dark alley.
answer: The shooting of 13-year-old Adam Toledo by Chicago police in April 2021 sparked widespread public concern over police practices.

formulation: Indianapolis FedEx shooting: Nine people are killed, including the shooter, and seven injured, in a mass shooting at a FedEx facility in Indianapolis.
answer: The tragic event involving a mass shooting that occurred in Indianapolis on April 15, 2021, was the Indianapolis Massacre, which resulted in the deaths of nine people, including the shooter, and injuries to several others.

formulation: The media reports that U.S. Republican Representatives Marjorie Taylor Greene and Paul Gosar are forming the America First Caucus. It is scrapped within a day, following criticism from other GOP members.
answer: The "Freedom Caucus" was formed on April 16, 2021, but was quickly abandoned due to backlash from within the GOP.

formulation: COVID-19 drug development: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) revokes the emergency use authorization (EUA) for bamlanivimab.
answer: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) revoked the emergency use authorization for bamlanivimab on April 16, 2021, due to concerns about its effectiveness against certain variants of the SARS-CoV-2 virus.

formulation: Virginia reports its first two cases of the Lineage P.1 variant, which was originally detected in Brazil.
answer: On April 16, 2021, Virginia reported its first case of the P.1 variant, which was initially identified in Brazil.

formulation: Michigan extends their restrictions on gatherings and dining to May 24 amid a rise of cases. The state also expands their mask mandate to children ages 2–4 years.
answer: In response to the rise in COVID-19 cases in mid-April 2021, Michigan implemented stricter restrictions on gatherings, dining, and mask mandates, including limiting indoor dining to 25% capacity, reducing the size of gatherings, and reinstating mask requirements in public indoor spaces.

formulation: The number of vaccines administered in the United States exceeds 200 million.
answer: Around mid-April 2021, the United States reached a significant milestone in its COVID-19 vaccination efforts by administering over 100 million doses, marking a major step towards achieving herd immunity and controlling the pandemic.

formulation: Canada registers more new daily COVID-19 cases than the US for the first time as infections surge in Ontario.
answer: On April 17, 2021, Canada reported its highest daily COVID-19 case count since the start of the pandemic, with a significant increase in Ontario.

formulation: Global COVID-19 death toll passes three million (Johns Hopkins University figures).
answer: On April 17, 2021, Johns Hopkins University reported that the global COVID-19 pandemic had reached a significant milestone with over 140 million confirmed cases worldwide.

formulation: San Jose Sharks forward Patrick Marleau ties Gordie Howe's NHL record for most regular season games played at 1,767.
answer: As of mid-April 2021, Gordie Howe's record for the most regular season games played was tied by Mark Messier.

formulation: 12-team European Super League is announced to widespread condemnation amongst governments, non-involved clubs, press and fans; amidst the furore all 6 EPL clubs withdraw within 3 days.
answer: The European Super League, announced in April 2021, faced immediate backlash from fans, governments, and other clubs, leading to the withdrawal of all six English Premier League teams within three days.

formulation: COVID-19 vaccination: The CDC reports that over 50% of Americans have received at least one dose of a COVID-19 vaccine. At least 130 million adults have received the first dose, while 84 million adults have also received the second dose.
answer: Around mid-April 2021, the CDC reported that over 100 million Americans had received at least one dose of the COVID-19 vaccine.

formulation: Cuba's Communist party announces Miguel Díaz-Canel will replace Raúl Castro as party leader, after the latter steps down.
answer: On April 19, 2021, Miguel Díaz-Canel succeeded Raúl Castro as the First Secretary of the Communist Party of Cuba, marking a significant leadership change in the country.

formulation: In Las Vegas, Nevada: San Jose Sharks forward Patrick Marleau breaks Gordie Howe's NHL record for most games played, now at 1,768 and counting.
answer: On April 19, 2021, in Las Vegas, Nevada, San Jose Sharks forward Patrick Marleau broke the NHL record for most career games played by a player, surpassing Gordie Howe's previous record of 1,767 games.

formulation: NASA successfully flies its drone helicopter Ingenuity on Mars, first powered aircraft to fly on another world.
answer: On April 19, 2021, NASA's Ingenuity Mars Helicopter successfully completed its first powered, controlled flight on Mars, marking the first powered, controlled flight on another planet.

formulation: New Zealand and Australia open a travel bubble between the two countries after more than a year of border closures.
answer: On April 19, 2021, New Zealand and Australia established the Trans-Tasman Travel Bubble, allowing citizens of both countries to travel between them without quarantine.

formulation: All six EPL clubs withdraw from the controversial European Super League just 3 days after it was announced - Chelsea, Manchester City, Liverpool, Arsenal, Manchester United and Tottenham.
answer: The European Super League, a proposed breakaway competition involving six English Premier League clubs, was announced in April 2021 but withdrew just three days later due to widespread backlash and protests from fans, players, and other football stakeholders.

formulation: Former police officer Derek Chauvin convicted of the murder of George Floyd in Minneapolis, in a case that prompted huge nationwide racial justice protests.
answer: On April 20, 2021, former Minneapolis police officer Derek Chauvin was found guilty of all charges related to the murder of George Floyd, marking a significant verdict in the fight for racial justice.

formulation: Record number of new COVID-19 cases reported (5.24 million) in one week around the world according to WHO, with a third in India.
answer: The significant global health event that occurred in April 2021, involving a surge of COVID-19 cases particularly affecting India and reported by the WHO, was the second wave of the pandemic in India.

formulation: Trial of Derek Chauvin: Derek Chauvin is found guilty on all counts in the murder of George Floyd.
answer: Former police officer Derek Chauvin was found guilty of second-degree unintentional murder, third-degree murder, and second-degree manslaughter in the death of George Floyd.

formulation: Killing of Ma'Khia Bryant: A 16 year old in Columbus, Ohio is shot and killed by police officer, Nicholas Reardon.
answer: The incident involving the shooting of a 16-year-old girl by a police officer in Columbus, Ohio on April 20, 2021, was the shooting of Ma'Khia Bryant.

formulation: Indonesian submarine RI Nanggala sinks off the coast of Bali with the loss of all 53 people on board.
answer: The significant naval tragedy that occurred off the coast of Bali in April 2021, resulting in the loss of all 53 crew members on board the Indonesian submarine RI Nanggala, was the sinking of the submarine during a torpedo exercise.

formulation: Manhattan district attorney's office announces it will no longer prosecute prostitution, dismissing 914 open cases, part of growing movement to change approach to prostitution.
answer: On April 21, 2021, the Manhattan District Attorney's office announced it would no longer prosecute individuals for prostitution, focusing instead on holding those who exploit and profit from sex trafficking accountable.

formulation: Michigan surpasses 800,000 confirmed cases and 17,000 confirmed deaths.
answer: In April 2021, Michigan reached a significant milestone by surpassing 1 million confirmed COVID-19 cases and 20,000 deaths.

formulation: South Dakota confirms their first case of the Lineage P.1 variant in Pennington County.
answer: The first case of the B.1.1.7 variant of COVID-19 was reported in Pennington County, South Dakota, on April 21, 2021.

formulation: India sets a world record for daily COVID-19 cases recording 314,835 new cases with 2,104 deaths.
answer: On April 22, 2021, India reached a significant milestone by recording over 300,000 new COVID-19 cases in a single day, marking a crucial moment in the pandemic.

formulation: US President Joe Biden pledges to cut US carbon emissions by 50-52% below 2005 levels by 2030 at a virtual climate summit.
answer: President Joe Biden announced a commitment to reduce U.S. greenhouse gas emissions by 50-52% below 2005 levels by 2030.

formulation: President Biden pledges to cut greenhouse gas emissions in half by 2030 compared to 2005 levels.
answer: President Biden announced a commitment to reduce greenhouse gas emissions by 50-52% below 2005 levels by 2030.

formulation: At least 82 COVID-19 patients die in a fire at Ibn Khatib hospital in Baghdad, Iraq, with 100 more injured.
answer: On April 24, 2021, a tragic incident occurred in Baghdad, Iraq, where a fire broke out at a COVID-19 treatment center, resulting in the deaths of at least 82 COVID-19 patients and injuries to around 100 others.

formulation: Joe Biden becomes the first US President to officially recognize killing of Armenians in the Ottoman empire during WWII as 'genocide'.
answer: On April 24, 2021, President Joe Biden officially recognized the mass killings of Armenians by the Ottoman Empire during World War I as genocide.

formulation: A runoff election is held in Louisiana's 2nd congressional district vacant since Representative Cedric Richmond resigned to become the Director of the Office of Public Liaison and an advisor to President Biden. Troy Carter wins with 48,511 of the 87,806 votes cast (55.25%).
answer: On April 24, 2021, a special election was held in Louisiana's 2nd congressional district to fill the vacancy left by the resignation of Representative Cedric Richmond.

formulation: A viral Internet meme encourages users named Josh Swain to compete at an event in Lincoln, Nebraska and battle for the right to use the name Josh Swain. The event draws a crowd of several hundred people, and raises over $8,000 in charity.
answer: On April 24, 2021, a unique event called the "Josh Swain Name Contest" took place in Lincoln, Nebraska, where people named Josh Swain competed for the right to their name while raising money for charity.

formulation: The 93rd Academy Awards, the third in a row with no official host, are held at both Union Station and Dolby Theatre in Los Angeles. Due to the ceremony's delay from February 28 due to the impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on cinema, films from two calendar years were eligible at the same point, with the cut-off date being the intended original Awards date. Chloé Zhao's Nomadland wins three awards, including Best Picture, Best Director and Frances McDormand for Best Actress. David Fincher's Mank leads the nominations with ten, while Anthony Hopkins wins Best Actor for The Father (becoming the oldest winner in an acting category), Daniel Kaluuya Best Supporting Actor for Judas and the Black Messiah and Youn Yuh-jung Best Supporting Actress for Minari. Keeping in line with other award ceremonies reporting viewership declines, the telecast garners 10.4 million viewers according to Nielsen estimates, down 56% from the previous year and making the broadcast by far the lowest-rated in Oscar history.
answer: The 93rd Academy Awards ceremony took place on April 25, 2021, where "Nomadland" won Best Picture and Best Director, and Anthony Hopkins won Best Actor for "The Father".

formulation: The US, the EU and other countries announce they are sending pandemic aid to India as it's COVID-19 crisis continues to worsen.
answer: In April 2021, as India faced an overwhelming surge in COVID-19 cases, the international community responded with a significant outpouring of medical aid, including the donation of oxygen supplies, ventilators, and vaccines from various countries and organizations.

formulation: US Census results shows its population growth second slowest in recorded history, population at 331,449,281 with only 7.4% increase on 2010.
answer: The U.S. population increased by 7.4% according to the 2020 Census results released in April 2021.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic – The CDC says that fully vaccinated Americans can go outside without wearing a mask unless they are in large crowds.
answer: The CDC announced that fully vaccinated Americans no longer need to wear masks outdoors.

formulation: Pfizer announces it is working on a new antiviral therapy to treat COVID-19 at its onset and prevent hospitalization.
answer: On April 27, 2021, Pfizer announced that its antiviral drug, Paxlovid, had shown significant efficacy in reducing the risk of hospitalization and death in high-risk COVID-19 patients.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic – Colorado surpasses 500,000 cases of COVID-19.
answer: On April 27, 2021, Colorado achieved the milestone of surpassing 500,000 confirmed COVID-19 cases.

formulation: NASA's Parker Solar Probe becomes the first spacecraft to cross the Alfvén critical boundary, the outer atmosphere of the Sun.
answer: On April 28, 2021, NASA's Parker Solar Probe successfully crossed into the Sun's outer atmosphere, marking a historic first in space exploration.

formulation: US President Joe Biden makes a major speech to a joint session of Congress calling for a new era of government spending.
answer: President Joe Biden delivered the State of the Union Address on April 28, 2021, advocating for increased government spending and reforms.

formulation: 2021 Joe Biden speech to a joint session of Congress: On the eve of his 100th day in office, President Biden gives his first address to a joint session of Congress encouraging them to pass $4 trillion worth of spending bills, including the American Jobs Plan and the American Families Plan, both part of his Build Back Better Plan.
answer: President Joe Biden delivered a significant speech to Congress on April 28, 2021, outlining his major spending proposals, including the American Jobs Plan and the American Families Plan, as he approached his 100th day in office.

formulation: The South Dakota Supreme Court hears oral arguments on an appeal of a ruling which struck down South Dakota Amendment A, which would have legalized recreational cannabis in the state on July 1, 2021.
answer: On April 28, 2021, South Dakota's attempt to legalize recreational cannabis was struck down by a federal judge, who ruled that the state's ballot initiative process was unconstitutional.

formulation: Brazil's official COVID-19 death toll passes 400,000, with daily fatalities at 3,000, down from 4,000.
answer: Brazil reached a significant milestone in its battle against COVID-19 on April 29, 2021, as daily fatalities showed a decline, marking a positive trend in the country's fight against the pandemic.

formulation: World's longest pedestrian bridge at 516 metres (1,700 feet) opens inside northern Portugal's Arouca Geopark.
answer: The Viana do Castelo to Paredes de Coura cycling and walking path, known as the "Greenway of the Minho," was inaugurated on April 29, 2021.

formulation: 45 killed and 150 injured in a crush of people at the Israeli Lag B'Omer festival at Mount Meron.
answer: A tragic stampede occurred during the annual Lag BaOmer bonfire celebration in Jerusalem, Israel, on April 30, 2021, resulting in the deaths of 45 people and injuries to 150 others.

formulation: Australia announces a ban on citizens returning from India, stranding 8,000 people, and making it a criminal offence to return, amid India's COVID-19 crisis - first democratic country to do so.
answer: Australia banned its citizens from traveling from India amid the COVID-19 crisis in late April 2021.

formulation: Travel restrictions related to the COVID-19 pandemic – The White House announces the U.S. will begin restricting travel from India starting May 4 due to rising cases of the Lineage B.1.617 which originated in the latter country.
answer: The U.S. announced a temporary ban on travel from India in late April 2021 due to the rapid spread of the highly contagious Delta variant of COVID-19.

formulation: Michigan reports its first case of Lineage B.1.617, first discovered in India, in a person from Clinton County.
answer: The Delta variant, first identified in India, was reported in Michigan on April 30, 2021.

formulation: India is the first country to record more than 400,000 new COVID-19 cases in one day (401,993).
answer: India reached a significant milestone on May 1, 2021, by recording over 400,000 new COVID-19 cases in a single day, marking the first time any country exceeded this threshold.

formulation: Lubbock, Texas votes to become the largest city in U.S. to ban abortion with the "sanctuary city for the unborn".
answer: Lubbock, Texas passed a city ordinance banning abortions after 20 weeks of pregnancy on May 1, 2021.

formulation: DR Congo announces the end of the latest Ebola outbreak after three months with a death toll of six.
answer: The Democratic Republic of the Congo declared the end of the Ebola outbreak on May 3, 2021, after successfully containing the virus and preventing further spread.

formulation: Former U.S. Senator and astronaut Bill Nelson, becomes Administrator of NASA.
answer: On May 3, 2021, NASA announced the appointment of former U.S. Senator and astronaut Bill Nelson as its new Administrator.

formulation: German police announce operation and arrests into 'Boystown' world's largest child abuse image website with 400,000 members worldwide.
answer: Operation "Pentagon" was carried out by German police on May 3, 2021, targeting one of the largest child abuse image websites, ultimately resulting in numerous arrests.

formulation: Subway overpass carrying a train collapses in Mexico City killing at least 24 people.
answer: The major infrastructure failure in Mexico City that occurred on May 3, 2021, resulting in the tragic deaths of at least 24 people, was the collapse of a section of the Viaducto Miguel Alemán, a major elevated highway.

formulation: US Environmental Protection Agency takes first significant step against climate change by announcing new limits on hydrofluorocarbons (-85% over 15 years).
answer: The US Environmental Protection Agency finalized a rule to regulate greenhouse gas emissions from new and existing power plants, aiming to reduce carbon pollution and combat climate change.

formulation: World Snooker Championship, Crucible Theatre, Sheffield: Englishman Mark Selby wins his 4th world title with an 18-15 win over countryman Shaun Murphy.
answer: The 2021 World Snooker Championship took place in May 2021, where Mark Selby claimed his fourth world title against Shaun Murphy.

formulation: Malian woman Halima Cisse gives birth to nonuplets (nine babies) in Morocco, in only the third known case worldwide.
answer: On May 4, 2021, a Malian woman in Morocco gave birth to nine babies, marking only the third known case of nonuplets in history.

formulation: US President Joe Biden announces new goal of 160 million people, nearly of 70% of adults, vaccinated by July 4.
answer: President Joe Biden announced a goal to have nearly 70% of adults in the U.S. vaccinated by July 4, 2021.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic – Michigan relaxes several restrictions regarding face mask requirements and outdoor gatherings.
answer: On May 4, 2021, Michigan lifted its statewide face mask mandate and allowed outdoor gatherings of up to 100 people without restrictions, in response to the COVID-19 pandemic.

formulation: A week of mass protests and demonstrations against government tax reform and poverty in Colombia leaves 24 dead.
answer: The significant event was the nationwide protests and demonstrations in Colombia in early May 2021, which resulted in the loss of 24 lives due to opposition against government tax reform and poverty issues.

formulation: Baltimore Orioles pitcher John Means no-hits Seattle Mariners, 6-0 at T-Mobile Park, Seattle.
answer: On May 5, 2021, John Means pitched a no-hitter against the Seattle Mariners, becoming the first Baltimore Orioles pitcher to achieve this feat since 1969.

formulation: Canada is the first country to authorize the Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine for 12-15 year olds.
answer: On May 5, 2021, Canada approved the use of the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine for adolescents aged 12 to 15 years.

formulation: Evidence of Africa's earliest burial, a three-year-old boy, 78,000 years ago, in a cave in Kenya published.
answer: The significant archaeological discovery published on May 5, 2021, was the unearthing of Africa's earliest known burial site, dating back 78,000 years, involving a young child in Kenya.

formulation: The possible eviction of Palestinian families from a Jerusalem neighborhood begins days of unrest in the city, injuring hundreds.
answer: In early May 2021, a significant event related to political tensions in Jerusalem was the escalation of violence between Israeli security forces and Palestinian protesters during the annual Al-Aqsa Mosque compound protests, resulting in widespread unrest and injuries among the population.

formulation: US President Joe Biden announces the US will support temporarily lifting patent protection on COVID-19 vaccines with the WHO.
answer: President Joe Biden announced on May 5, 2021, that the United States would support waiving intellectual property protections for COVID-19 vaccines to increase global access.

formulation: South Carolina House votes to add firing squad to execution methods; South Carolina would become the fourth state to use firing squad after Mississippi, Oklahoma and Utah.
answer: On May 5, 2021, South Carolina passed a law authorizing the use of firing squads as an execution method, becoming the fourth state to do so after Mississippi, Oklahoma, and Utah.

formulation: Armed police raid on drug traffickers kills 25 in cities deadliest ever, in a favela of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil.
answer: On May 6, 2021, a police operation in the Maré favela of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, resulted in the deaths of 25 people during a confrontation with drug traffickers.

formulation: Cincinnati Reds pitcher Wade Miley no-hits Cleveland Indians, 3-0 at Progressive Field, Cleveland.
answer: Wade Miley pitched a no-hitter against the Cleveland Indians on May 7, 2021.

formulation: Former police officer and suspected serial killer Hugo Ernesto Osorio Chávez arrested in Chalchuapa, El Salvador, after a mass grave of 15-40 bodies found at his house.
answer: On May 7, 2021, a former police officer named Carlos Mejía was arrested in Chalchuapa, El Salvador, for his alleged involvement in a mass grave containing numerous bodies.

formulation: Ransomware attack on US Colonial pipeline by the DarkSide criminal group stops supply to half of east coast.
answer: The Colonial Pipeline ransomware attack occurred on May 7, 2021, disrupting fuel supply on the East Coast of the United States and was attributed to the DarkSide criminal group.

formulation: The World Health Organization approves the Chinese COVID-19 vaccine Sinopharm, its first made by a non-western country.
answer: On May 7, 2021, the World Health Organization approved the first COVID-19 vaccine developed by a non-Western country, the Sinopharm vaccine from China, marking a significant milestone in global health.

formulation: Colonial Pipeline cyberattack: An oil pipeline in Houston is hacked by DarkSide causing the pipeline operator to shut down its entire network, the source of nearly half of the U.S. East Coast's fuel supply.
answer: The Colonial Pipeline cyberattack occurred in early May 2021, affecting a significant oil pipeline in the United States and leading to a shutdown of the pipeline network that supplies nearly half of the U.S. East Coast's fuel.

formulation: COVID-19 vaccines – Pfizer/BioNTech seek full approval from the FDA for the Pfizer–BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine.
answer: On May 7, 2021, Pfizer and BioNTech submitted an application to the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for emergency use authorization of their COVID-19 vaccine for children aged 12 to 15 years old.

formulation: Bombings outside a school in Kabul, Afghanistan, kill at least 50 people, mostly teenage girls, amid growing fears about US military withdrawal.
answer: On May 8, 2021, a suicide bombing at a girls' school in Kabul, Afghanistan, killed at least 80 people, including many teenage girls, underscoring the ongoing dangers faced by civilians and the challenges of the US military's withdrawal from the region.

formulation: Indian Medical Association calls for a national lockdown, criticizing President Modi's government's response as recorded COVID-19 deaths pass 4,000 a day.
answer: The Indian Medical Association called for a nationwide lockdown on May 8, 2021, in response to the increasing daily COVID-19 death toll, which surpassed 4,000.

formulation: 2021 Colorado Springs shooting: Seven people are shot dead at a birthday party in Colorado Springs, Colorado.
answer: A mass shooting occurred in Colorado Springs on May 9, 2021, where multiple individuals lost their lives during a birthday celebration.

formulation: Chinese safari park in Fuyang forced to apologize for not informing the public that three leopards had escaped April 19 and been roaming nearby neighborhoods.
answer: In May 2021, a safari park in China failed to notify the public about escaped leopards, leading to a dangerous situation for visitors.

formulation: US F.D.A. authorizes the Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine for 12-to-15-year-olds.
answer: On May 10, 2021, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) authorized the emergency use of the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine for individuals aged 12 to 15 years.

formulation: Violence escalates between Palestinians and Israelis after Israeli officers enter Aqsa Mosque in Jerusalem, rockets then fired from Gaza and airstrikes from Israel kill at least 31.
answer: On May 10, 2021, a significant escalation of violence occurred in Jerusalem and Gaza when Israeli police forcibly removed Palestinian worshippers from the Al-Aqsa Mosque compound, leading to widespread protests, clashes, and a subsequent Israeli military operation in Gaza that resulted in numerous casualties and extensive destruction.

formulation: World Health Organization classifies the Indian COVID-19 variant B.1.617 as a variant of global concern.
answer: The World Health Organization classified the Indian COVID-19 variant as a "variant of concern" on May 10, 2021.

formulation: COVID-19 vaccination: The FDA authorizes the Pfizer–BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine for adolescents aged 12–15 years old.
answer: On May 10, 2021, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration authorized the emergency use of the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine for adolescents aged 12–15 in the United States.

formulation: China census figures show country's population 1.41 billion people, growth at its slowest since 1960s, (+0.53 down from +0.57).
answer: In May 2021, China reported that its population growth rate had slowed to the lowest level since the 1960s, with the country's population increasing by just 480,000 people in 2020, the smallest annual increase since 1961.

formulation: First major US offshore windfarm off the coast of Massachusetts approved by Biden administration.
answer: The Biden administration approved the "Clean Energy Standard" on May 11, 2021, to boost renewable energy in the United States.

formulation: Northern Ireland inquest into 1971 Ballymurphy killing of ten people finds people were innocent and killed (nine by soldiers) using unjustified force.
answer: The significant inquest outcome regarding the killings in Ballymurphy, which occurred during a 1971 incident in Northern Ireland, was announced on May 11, 2021, and it concluded that the deaths of the 10 civilians were unlawful killings by the British Army.

formulation: The Colonial Pipeline shutdown enters its fifth day. Panic buying by motorists causes many eastern seaboard gas stations to begin running dry. U.S. Energy Secretary Jennifer Granholm urges calm and to not hoard.
answer: The significant event in May 2021 that led to panic buying at gas stations along the eastern seaboard of the United States, prompting the U.S. Energy Secretary to urge calm among motorists, was the announcement of a potential oil pipeline shutdown due to a leak.

formulation: Colonial Pipeline begins restarting, but warns that it will take several days for things to return to normal operations.
answer: The Colonial Pipeline, a major fuel pipeline in the United States, faced a cyberattack in early May 2021, leading to a significant disruption in fuel supply and subsequently announced a restart of operations on May 12, 2021.

formulation: COVID-19 vaccination – The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) adopts the FDA recommendation to provide the Pfizer–BioNTech vaccine to adolescents aged 12–15 years old.
answer: On May 12, 2021, the United States expanded its COVID-19 vaccination rollout to include young adolescents aged 12-15, marking a significant milestone in the country's efforts to combat the pandemic.

formulation: American CDC says people fully vaccinated against COVID-19 can stop wearing masks.
answer: The American CDC announced that fully vaccinated individuals no longer need to wear masks in most outdoor and indoor settings, except where required by local laws or regulations.

formulation: Gaza conflict has killed 103 people in Palestine, including 27 children, through Israeli airstrikes, more than 1000 rockets fired into Israel by Gaza militants killing seven, city of Lod center of street fighting.
answer: In May 2021, a significant escalation in violence occurred in Gaza and Israel, resulting in a high number of casualties, including children, and street fighting in the city of Lod, known as the "May 2021 Israel–Gaza conflict" or "Gaza War of May 2021."

formulation: World's largest iceberg 'A-76' at 1,667-square-miles (4,320 square km) calves off the Ronne Ice Shelf in Antarctica.
answer: On May 13, 2021, a massive iceberg, named A-76, calved from the Ronne Ice Shelf in Antarctica, measuring approximately 1,636 square miles (4,237 square kilometers) and becoming one of the largest icebergs ever recorded.

formulation: COVID-19 pandemic – The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention states that all "fully vaccinated people can resume activities without wearing a mask or physically distancing, except where required by federal, state, local, tribal, or territorial laws, rules, and regulations, including local business and workplace guidance".
answer: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention announced on May 13, 2021, that fully vaccinated individuals no longer need to wear masks or physically distance in most indoor and outdoor settings, except where required by federal, state, local, tribal, or territorial laws, rules, and regulations, including local business and workplace guidance.

formulation: Colonial Pipeline operations return to normal late in the day, but gas outages at retail stations will take several days to clear.
answer: A cyberattack on Colonial Pipeline, a major fuel supplier, led to a temporary shutdown of its operations, causing widespread gas shortages and outages at retail stations across multiple states.

formulation: Tennessee Gov. Bill Lee signs public school "bathroom bill", HB1233,  into law. The bill specifies that schools must comply to reasonable requests made by students and staff to provide them with access to a reasonably private bathroom that is restricted to occupants of their same sex.
answer: Tennessee Governor Bill Lee signed the "Student Privacy Protection Act" into law in May 2021, which allows students to use bathrooms and locker rooms that correspond to their gender identity.

formulation: China lands its Zhurong rover on Utopia Planitia, Mars, for the first time as part of the Tianwen-1 mission.
answer: On May 15, 2021, China's Tianwen-1 mission successfully landed the Zhurong rover on Mars, marking the country's first successful Mars landing and a significant milestone in space exploration.

formulation: Death toll passes 200 from Gaza conflict as 42 people killed in Israeli airstrikes and three building flattened.
answer: On May 16, 2021, Israel launched a significant escalation in violence against Gaza, resulting in over 200 deaths and extensive destruction from airstrikes.

formulation: Taiwan imposes tough restrictions against COVID-19 as a recent spike in cases threatens their up-to-now pandemic success.
answer: In mid-May 2021, Taiwan implemented stricter border controls, enhanced quarantine measures, and increased testing and contact tracing to combat the surge in COVID-19 cases.

formulation: Cyclone Tauktae makes landfall in the Indian state of Gujarat with wind speeds of up to 160km/h (100mph).
answer: A severe cyclonic storm named Tauktae hit the Indian state of Gujarat on May 17, 2021, bringing wind speeds of up to 160 km/h (100 mph).

formulation: Long working hours killed 745,000 people a year, in 2016, in the first study of its kind by the World Health Organization.
answer: The World Health Organization revealed in 2021 that working 55 hours or more per week increases the risk of stroke by 35% and the risk of heart disease by 17%, contributing to an estimated 745,000 deaths annually worldwide.

formulation: Former Matt Gaetz associate Joel Greenberg pleads guilty to six charges of sex trafficking.
answer: On May 17, 2021, Joel Greenberg was sentenced to 10 years in prison for his involvement in sex trafficking.

formulation: The U.S. Supreme Court agrees to take up Dobbs v. Jackson Women's Health Organization, a Mississippi case on abortion rights.
answer: The U.S. Supreme Court agreed to review the case of Dobbs v. Jackson Women's Health Organization on May 17, 2021.

formulation: India records the highest recorded daily COVID-19 death toll to date in the world with 4,529 deaths.
answer: On May 18, 2021, India recorded over 4,000 deaths in a single day due to COVID-19, marking a tragic milestone in global death toll statistics.

formulation: MLB Detroit Tigers pitcher Spencer Turnbull no-hits Seattle Mariners, 5-0 at Comerica Park, Detroit.
answer: Spencer Turnbull achieved a no-hitter on June 24, 2021, while playing against the Seattle Mariners in Detroit.

formulation: Argentine President Alberto Fernandez announces a 'circuit-breaker lockdown' as the country records over 39,000 daily COVID-19 cases.
answer: Argentina's President announced a strict lockdown in response to the surge of over 39,000 daily COVID-19 cases.

formulation: BBC investigation finds their 1995 Princess Dianna interview was secured through 'deceitful behavior' by journalist Martin Bashir.
answer: The BBC investigation revealed that Martin Bashir had fabricated evidence to secure Princess Diana's interview, including forging bank statements and manipulating sources.

formulation: New York City begins re-opening after 423 days (March 2020) with the COVID-19 death toll at 33,000.
answer: On May 19, 2021, New York City reached a significant milestone in its COVID-19 pandemic response by lifting all remaining restrictions, marking a major turning point in the city's re-opening efforts after over a year of stringent measures.

formulation: New York Yankees pitcher Cory Kluber no-hits Texas Rangers, 2-0 at Globe Life Field, Arlington, Texas.
answer: On May 19, 2021, Yankees pitcher Cory Kluber was traded to the Texas Rangers in a significant MLB transaction.

formulation: The EU agrees to open its borders to vaccinated travelers from safe countries.
answer: On May 19, 2021, the European Union announced a new travel policy allowing vaccinated individuals from designated safe countries to enter the EU without quarantine or testing requirements.

formulation: Israel and Hamas agree to a bilateral ceasefire in Gaza after nearly two weeks of fighting, amid international diplomatic efforts.
answer: On May 20, 2021, a significant diplomatic breakthrough occurred when Israel and Hamas agreed to a ceasefire, ending nearly two weeks of intense conflict in the Gaza Strip.

formulation: One of Sri Lanka's worst ecological disasters as cargo ship MS X-Press Pearl, carrying toxic chemicals, catches fire off the country's coast and begins spilling debris.
answer: The MV X-Press Pearl cargo ship caught fire and sank off the coast of Sri Lanka on May 20, 2021, releasing toxic chemicals and causing a significant environmental disaster.

formulation: Most powerful cosmic ray since the Oh-My-God particle detected by Osaka University from Utah's Array Telescope measuring 240 exa-electronvolts (EeV; 1018 electronvolts) - nicknamed ‘Amaterasu’.
answer: The detection of a cosmic ray with an energy of 240 exa-electronvolts, reported by Osaka University on May 21, 2021, is named after the Japanese goddess Amaterasu.

formulation: 30-year-old Scottish light-welterweight boxer Josh Taylor becomes Britain's first undisputed world champion in the four-belt era by beating Jose Ramirez by unanimous decision in Las Vegas.
answer: Josh Taylor won the WBA, IBF, and WBO world titles in the super-lightweight division by defeating Jose Ramirez in a unanimous decision on May 22, 2021, in Las Vegas.

formulation: Mount Nyiragongo erupts in the Democratic Republic of Congo, sending rivers of lava towards the nearby city of Goma, prompting evacuations.
answer: The eruption of the Nyiragongo volcano on May 22, 2021, in the Democratic Republic of Congo, resulted in lava flows threatening the city of Goma and leading to evacuations.

formulation: 21 runners die in freezing conditions during an ultramarathon in Yellow River Stone Forest Park, Gansu Province, China.
answer: The tragic sports-related incident that occurred in Gansu Province, China, on May 23, 2021, was the 2021 Gansu Huangyagou Ultramarathon disaster, where 21 runners died due to freezing conditions during the event.

formulation: Belarus accused of “state-sponsored hijacking" after diverting commercial Ryanair flight to Minsk to arrest dissident journalist Roman Protasevich.
answer: On May 23, 2021, a Ryanair flight from Athens to Vilnius was diverted to Minsk, Belarus, where the dissident journalist Roman Protasevich was arrested upon landing.

formulation: Constitutional crisis deepens in Samoa after Speaker of the House shuts out Fiame Naomi Mata’afa from being sworn in as the country's first woman leader in 56 years.
answer: On May 24, 2021, Fiame Naomi Mata’afa was excluded from being sworn in as Samoa's first woman leader due to a constitutional crisis and a dispute over the country's political system.

formulation: India's official COVID-19 death toll passes 300,000 (303,720), the third country to do so, with experts saying it is a vast undercount.
answer: India reached a significant milestone in COVID-19-related deaths on May 24, 2021, with the official count surpassing 300,000, raising concerns about the accuracy of the reported figures due to potential underreporting and discrepancies in data collection.

formulation: The State Department tells Americans not to travel to Japan due to a spike in COVID-19 cases there.
answer: The U.S. State Department issued a Level 4 travel advisory for Japan on May 24, 2021, due to the high level of COVID-19 cases.

formulation: Delaware reports their first case of the Lineage B.1.617 variant that originated in India.
answer: The Delta variant, first identified in India, was reported for the first time in Delaware on May 24, 2021.

formulation: A suspicious package is sent to the home of U.S. Senator Rand Paul (R–KY). The incident is being investigated by the Federal Bureau of Investigation and United States Capitol Police.
answer: On May 24, 2021, a suspicious package addressed to U.S. Senator Ron Johnson's home in Wisconsin was intercepted and investigated by the FBI and Capitol Police, leading to the discovery of a hoax device.

formulation: Coup in Mali as military Colonel Assimi Goïta ousts country's civilian President Bah Ndaw and Prime Minister Moctar Ouane arresting and detaining them.
answer: On May 25, 2021, a military coup in Mali led to the ousting of President Ibrahim Boubacar Keïta and Prime Minister Boubou Cissé by Colonel Assimi Goïta.

formulation: New research show impact of 'climate racism' in the US, with black people facing double (+3.12C) the amount of heat stress in urban areas.
answer: Recent studies have highlighted the disproportionate effects of climate change on black communities in urban areas, particularly regarding heat stress experienced since May 2021, showing that these communities are more vulnerable to extreme heat due to factors such as limited access to green spaces, poor housing conditions, and systemic inequalities.

formulation: US CDC says half of all US adults are now fully vaccinated, with 61% having had their first shot.
answer: On May 25, 2021, the CDC reported that over 50% of the U.S. population had received at least one dose of the COVID-19 vaccine.

formulation: 2021 George Floyd protests.
answer: The significant social justice protests that took place across the United States in late May 2021 were sparked by the death of George Floyd, an African American man, while in police custody.

formulation: New York City Mayoral candidate Shaun Donovan is arrested during a protest near the Holland Tunnel.
answer: On May 25, 2021, a New York City Mayoral candidate, Eric Adams, was involved in a significant event where he was arrested during protests and law enforcement actions related to the George Floyd case.

formulation: Protests break out across the country to mark the first anniversary of the murder of George Floyd.
answer: In May 2021, significant protests occurred across the United States to commemorate the anniversary of George Floyd's death, with demonstrators calling for justice, police reform, and an end to systemic racism.

formulation: Manhattan District Attorney Cyrus Vance Jr. announces that he has convened a grand jury in his criminal investigation into former President Trump over his real estate business, as well as the Trump Organization.
answer: Manhattan District Attorney Cyrus Vance Jr. took the significant legal step of filing a civil lawsuit against former President Trump's real estate business on May 25, 2021, alleging that it had failed to pay taxes on millions of dollars in income.

formulation: COVID-19 vaccination – The CDC announces that 50% of the American adult population has been fully vaccinated.
answer: On May 25, 2021, the CDC announced that more than half of all American adults had received at least one dose of the COVID-19 vaccine, marking a significant public health milestone.

formulation: COVID-19 vaccines – Moderna says that their vaccine is 100% effective in teenagers between the ages of 12 and 17 years old. They say that they will seek approval from the FDA in early June.
answer: In late May 2021, Moderna announced that its COVID-19 vaccine demonstrated 100% efficacy in preventing symptomatic infection in adolescents aged 12-17, and the company planned to submit data to the FDA for emergency use authorization in this age group.

formulation: Michigan surpasses 19,000 confirmed deaths from COVID-19.
answer: On May 25, 2021, Michigan reported surpassing 20,000 COVID-19 deaths, marking a significant milestone in the state's ongoing battle against the pandemic.

formulation: A super "blood" moon, the first total lunar eclipse for two years, visible across the Pacific.
answer: The significant astronomical event that occurred on May 26, 2021, and was visible across the Pacific was a total lunar eclipse, also known as a "Blood Moon," where the Moon appeared reddish due to the Earth's atmosphere scattering sunlight.

formulation: Amazon says it will buy 97-year-old film and television studio Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer for $8.45 billion.
answer: Amazon announced the acquisition of Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer (MGM) on May 26, 2021, for $8.45 billion.

formulation: Ferry sinks carrying about 150 people in Nigeria between Niger state and Kebbi state, with only 20 people rescued.
answer: The tragic maritime disaster that occurred in Nigeria on May 26, 2021, was the sinking of the MV Fidelis ferry, which resulted in the loss of approximately 130 lives.

formulation: In landmark case oil giant Royal Dutch Shell ordered by a Hague court to cut its global carbon emissions by 45% by 2030.
answer: On May 26, 2021, a Hague court ruled that Royal Dutch Shell must reduce its carbon emissions by 45% by 2030 compared to 2019 levels.

formulation: Nine people shot and killed by their colleague, a public transit employee in San Jose, California.
answer: On May 26, 2021, a tragic event occurred in San Jose, California, where a public transit employee, BART operator Richard Jarrett, intentionally crashed his train into a crowd at the Diridon Station, resulting in the deaths of nine individuals.

formulation: President Joe Biden orders US intelligence services to intensify their efforts to investigate the origins of COVID-19.
answer: President Joe Biden signed an executive order on May 26, 2021, to launch a comprehensive investigation into the origins of COVID-19.

formulation: Russia reports it has started vaccinating domestic animals against COVID-19, using the Karnivak-Kov vaccine.
answer: On May 26, 2021, Russia approved the world's first vaccine for animals against COVID-19, named Carnivac-Cov, for use in cats and dogs.

formulation: 2021 San Jose shooting: A mass shooting occurs at a Santa Clara Valley Transportation Authority rail yard in San Jose, California, leaving ten people dead, including the gunman who committed suicide.
answer: On May 26, 2021, a mass shooting at a transportation authority rail yard in San Jose, California, resulted in the deaths of ten individuals, including the perpetrator.

formulation: English playwright William Shakespeare reported to have died after receiving COVID-19 vaccine by Argentine news channel Chanal 26 (case of mistaken identity, the Bard died in 1616).
answer: In May 2021, a humorous and significant misinformation circulated in Argentina claiming that historical figures like Eva Perón and Che Guevara had been vaccinated against COVID-19, which was widely debunked as a joke.

formulation: US President Joe Biden calls for a ceasefire in the Tigray conflict, north Ethiopia, citing killings and "widespread sexual violence" as a weapon of war.
answer: On May 27, 2021, United Nations Secretary-General António Guterres called for an immediate ceasefire in the Tigray conflict, expressing grave concerns over human rights violations, including killings and sexual violence.

formulation: The Department of Energy launches Perlmutter, the world's fastest AI-specialized supercomputer, with four exaflops of performance.
answer: The Frontier supercomputer, a significant advancement in supercomputing known for its focus on artificial intelligence and boasting four exaflops of performance, was officially launched by the Department of Energy on May 27, 2021.

formulation: Discovery of a mass grave with the remains of 215 children from Kamloops Indian Residential School announced by First Nation in British Columbia, Canada.
answer: The Tk'emlúps te Secwépemc First Nation announced the discovery of the remains of 215 children buried in unmarked graves at the site of the former Kamloops Indian Residential School on May 28, 2021.

formulation: Tens of thousands of people march in Brazilian cities against President Jair Bolsonaro and his handling of the COVID-19 pandemic.
answer: In May 2021, Brazil witnessed significant protests against President Jair Bolsonaro's handling of the COVID-19 pandemic, with demonstrators demanding better public health measures and criticizing his downplaying of the virus's severity.

formulation: 2021 Hialeah shooting: A mass shooting in Hialeah, Florida leaves two dead and 20 injured.
answer: On May 30, 2021, a mass shooting occurred in Hialeah, Florida, resulting in two deaths and multiple injuries.

formulation: JBS S.A. cyberattack: A ransomware cyberattack hits several beef processing plants and slaughterhouses in Utah, Texas, Wisconsin, Nebraska, and Pennsylvania. Russian firm REvil has been accused of being the perpetrators of the attack.
answer: The significant cyberattack involving a major meat processing company that occurred in late May 2021, impacting facilities across multiple states in the U.S. and attributed to the Russian firm REvil, was the JBS Foods ransomware attack.

formulation: China's ruling Communist Party announces it will allow married couples to have three children, in effort to boost falling birthrates.
answer: On May 31, 2021, China's ruling Communist Party implemented a significant policy change by allowing all couples to have three children, aiming to address the country's declining birth rates.

formulation: Peru says its COVID-19 death toll is three times higher than its official count (180,764 vs 68,000), making it one of the hardest hit countries per capita.
answer: On July 20, 2021, Peru announced that its actual COVID-19 death toll was significantly higher than the official count, revealing severe discrepancies in its pandemic statistics.

formulation: Tulsa, Oklahoma, marks 100 year anniversary of the massacre of hundreds of black residents by a white mob in the Greenwood neighborhood.
answer: The 100th anniversary of the Tulsa Race Massacre was commemorated in 2021.

formulation: Malaysia begins a full two-week lockdown as COVID-19 cases surge with record 9,020 news cases recorded May 29.
answer: Malaysia implemented a nationwide lockdown on June 1, 2021, in response to a surge in COVID-19 cases, including a record of 9,020 new cases reported on May 29.

formulation: Prehistoric carvings, between 4,000 and 5,000 years old depicting deer, found in Scotland for the first time at Kilmartin Glen, Argyll.
answer: On June 1, 2021, archaeologists in Scotland discovered a series of ancient carvings of deer on a rock face, dating back to the Mesolithic period, which is considered a significant find in prehistoric art.

formulation: US President Joe Biden visits Tulsa, Oklahoma, marking 100 year anniversary of racial massacre in the Greenwood neighborhood.
answer: On June 1, 2021, the U.S. President attended a centennial commemoration of the tragic racial massacre in the Greenwood neighborhood of Tulsa, Oklahoma, known as the Tulsa Race Massacre.

formulation: US President Joe Biden's administration suspends oil and gas leases in Alaska's Arctic National Wildlife Refuge, reversing Donald Trump's decision.
answer: On June 1, 2021, President Joe Biden revoked the lease sale for the Willow Project in Alaska, halting new oil and gas leasing on federal lands.

formulation: A firefighter is killed and another injured in a shooting at a Los Angeles County Fire Department station in Santa Clarita.
answer: On June 1, 2021, a tragic incident occurred at a Los Angeles County Fire Department station in Santa Clarita, where a fire broke out, resulting in the deaths of two firefighters and injuries to several others.

formulation: A special election is held in New Mexico to fill a vacancy in its 1st congressional district left by Deb Haaland when she resigned to become President Biden's Secretary of the Interior. Democrat Melanie Stansbury wins with 79,837 of the 132,262 votes cast (60.36%).
answer: On June 1, 2021, a special election was held in New Mexico to fill the congressional seat vacated by Deb Haaland after she resigned to join President Biden's cabinet.

formulation: SARS-CoV-2 Delta variant becomes the dominant strain of COVID-19 in the United States.
answer: The Delta variant of COVID-19 gained predominance in the United States around June 2021, significantly impacting public health measures and vaccine effectiveness discussions.

formulation: COVID-19 vaccines – Moderna seeks full approval from the FDA for the Moderna COVID-19 vaccine.
answer: Moderna submitted an application to the FDA for emergency use authorization of its COVID-19 vaccine on June 1, 2021.

formulation: Michigan lifts several face mask requirements at outdoor gatherings and loosens them at indoor gatherings and businesses. Fully vaccinated people are allowed to not wear masks in public, but unvaccinated and partially vaccinated people are still required to do so.
answer: In early June 2021, the state of Michigan implemented a policy requiring both vaccinated and unvaccinated individuals to wear face masks in indoor public spaces and on public transportation.

formulation: Paul Allard Hodgkins, a Tampa man who was seen in the U.S. Senate chamber during the January 6 riot at the United States Capitol, pleads guilty, making him the second suspect to do so after Jon Schaffer.
answer: On June 2, 2021, a man from Tampa, Florida, was sentenced to 10 years in prison for his role in the January 6 Capitol riot.

formulation: Devon Conway becomes 7th batsman in cricket history to score a double century in his Test debut; run out for 200 for New Zealand in 1st Test against England at Lord's.
answer: On June 3, 2021, New Zealand cricketer Tom Latham made history by becoming the seventh player ever to score a double century on his Test debut against England at Lord's.

formulation: NASA administrator Bill Nelson announces two new missions to study ‘Lost Habitable’ world of Venus in 2028 and 2030.
answer: NASA announced the selection of two new missions, DAVINCI+ and VERITAS, to study Venus in detail.

formulation: NASA launches 128 baby squid and 5,000 microscopic animals, to study effects of spaceflight, to the International Space Station aboard Space X's Falcon 9 rocket.
answer: On June 3, 2021, NASA and SpaceX launched the SpaceX Crew-2 mission, which included a marine biologist, Dr. Kate Rubins, to conduct research on the International Space Station, including studies on the effects of microgravity on marine life.

formulation: The FBI announces that it has opened an investigation into Postmaster General Louis DeJoy over campaign fundraising.
answer: The FBI announced that it was investigating Postmaster General Louis DeJoy for potential obstruction of justice and interference with the 2020 election.

formulation: Nepalese Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli makes a desperate plea for vaccines amid his country's devastating COVID-19 second wave, reporting nearly 9,000 daily cases late May.
answer: Nepalese Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli pleaded for international assistance in securing COVID-19 vaccines to combat the severe second wave of cases in early June 2021.

formulation: Facebook's Oversight Board announces its ban on former President Donald Trump's personal account will last until January 2023. Trump was originally banned for posting a message supporting the January 6 insurrectionists. It also announces that it will no longer grant blanket immunity to politicians who use its service, especially if their posts are deemed to be deceptive or abusive.
answer: Facebook's Oversight Board decided to reinstate former President Donald Trump's account but also recommended that Facebook should have a clear policy on deplatforming political figures and that the company should not have reinstated Trump's account without a clear policy in place.

formulation: District Judge Roger Benitez overturns California's ban on assault weapons.
answer: On June 4, 2021, District Judge Roger Benitez issued a preliminary injunction blocking California's "Assault Weapons Control Act" from taking effect, ruling that it violated the Second Amendment.

formulation: A letter to Apple's Tim Cook is made public, in which staff request more flexibility over remote work, following the company's decision to return its 150,000 employees to the office.
answer: A petition signed by over 10,000 Apple employees calling for more flexible remote work policies was leaked to the public in June 2021.

formulation: The FDA approves the first new medication since 2014, semaglutide (Wegovy), for chronic weight management.
answer: On June 4, 2021, the FDA approved Wegovy (semaglutide), a new weight management medication, marking the first new approval since 2014.

formulation: At least 160 killed by suspected Islamist extremists in Solhan, Burkina Faso amid a deepening security crisis in the region.
answer: On June 5, 2021, a tragic attack by suspected Islamist extremists in Burkina Faso resulted in a significant loss of life, highlighting the country's escalating security crisis.

formulation: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan promises to save the country's shores from a build-up of 'sea snot' (marine mucilage) due to pollution and climate change.
answer: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan promised to implement a comprehensive plan to reduce marine pollution by 2025, including stricter regulations on waste disposal and increased investment in coastal cleanup initiatives.

formulation: Aftermath of the January 6 United States Capitol attack – The Department of Justice says that over 465 people have been arrested since the January 6 attack. It is also seeking information on 250 other suspects.
